description:
While I never do trivia back home in LA, for some reason the urge to partake hit strong when I was visiting SF. So, after some research, I rounded up a group of friends to do Tuesday trivia at Southside.

After reading the reviews, I decided to come at 7 pm for the 8 pm trivia, in order to ensure we got a table. However, it didn't seem to be a big problem. When trivia started, there was only 5 teams, and the bar itself wasn't too packed.

For drinks, I really enjoyed the Hookers Boot and Smoked Oaxacan Neogrini (although beware that it most definitely tastes like smoke!). In general, I appreciated how the drinks here tended more towards smoky than sweet, and at around $13 each were reasonably priced for quality.

So... How was trivia, you ask? It was a lot of fun, even though we completely sucked! Even coming in last, the game was good and the atmosphere upbeat. Trivia or not, Southside is definitely a place to check out.
author: Angela C.

description:
Updating my previous review...

Just want to start off by saying that Whitney & Scott completely saved the day after what started off as an interesting customer experience. My friends & I were not treated the best by one bad apple but literally everyone else was AMAZING... We were throughly impressed by the variety of specialty cocktails on their drink menu. I ordered the "Southside" and It was pretty delicious! Trivia night seemed to be a huge hit as the place was pretty crowded with young professionals. 

Overall my friends & I enjoyed the atmosphere and look forward to coming back.
author: Lexy M.

description:
Pretty good standard SOMA bar with everything you'd expect. Decent selection of beer and the usual fare of spirits/cocktails. 

The reason I keep coming back is the relatively large amount of space inside with tables to sit at, even when it's kinda busy on a Friday or Saturday. They have jenga on some of the tables which can be a nice little group activity for people who can't hold a conversation otherwise.

It is a little weird that the guy checking IDs always interrogates you about whether you have knives or water(?) - so I guess make sure you pre-hydrate?
author: Joe B.

description: Our night didn't start as planned, couldn't get into pura the night club and temblé was so lame. Saw the bar down the street and told my friends let's go there! And totally glad we went in! Jay the bouncer was very friendly! Homie from Berkeley! Great DJ, loved the music he was playing! Overall great experience, definitely would come back!
author: Joce A.

description:
I've gone to Southside a few different times now for work happy hours or brought partners here. The space is really great, the finger foods are very tasty and the cocktails are delicious. On top of that, the beer selection here is top notch as well and from what I can tell, they often rotate a few taps bringing in new seasonal beers.

You can reserve some spaces I believe, otherwise there a big bar, communal high top seats and some lounge seating. There's sort of half outdoor patio, and the bartenders are pleasant peeps. Foodwise, the shishito peppers, truffle tater tots, and chicken fingers are all great choices. I've had a number of the whiskey cocktails including this spicey one they had on special one night, I think it was called the diablo and it was sort of a take on a whiskey sour I think (or maybe more like an old fashioned), but damn, it was so, so good.

When it's busy, you're just going to have to wait sometimes for the drinks. Any good cocktail bar cannot just spew out drinks left and right when they're making them from scratch. My only complaint is that they have all these tables, but you have to order everything from the bar. Seems like a waiter or 2 would go a long way in efficiency, at least for the bartenders to take in food/drink orders. 4.5 half stars so far...something I really, really wish we could give on Yelp...1/2 stars...oh well. Anyway, you find yourself in SOMA, this is worth a stop.
author: Nate E.

description: Came in late night look for food and we weren't disappointed. Those truffle tots are to die for. Pizza and wings were also sold. We will be back!
author: Chris M.

description: A decent option for happy hours in the fidi / soma area. I personally don't love the vibe as much since it's hard to find a place to sit but I do love the tater tots here.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Southside is a beautiful venue for an evening of drinks and fun.

We stopped by for late night dinner after listening to live music nearby. It was around 9/10PM and we were looking for a spot that had a kitchen open past 10PM. Yelp told us to come here. I called and the person who answered the phone said that the kitchen closes at 1AM! Heck yes.

The food menu was pretty small, but we already had a few drinks, and I knew that the truffle tater tots and margherita pizza were calling my name. Everything tasted great, and the flavors were fantastic. However, I think the only thing needing improvement would be the bread-stick-hard quality of the pizza dough. The crust was not fresh-tasting, even though the burrata and cherry tomatoes used were delicious and perfect. Just change the crust quality, and everything will be amazing.

I love the ambiance of the place. There are loungey short tables as well as taller bar tables and bar seating too, so it's perfect for small groups, date night, or larger parties looking for a fun night. We enjoyed people watching. The vibes are dimly lit and on the sexier side for a bar--without being on the opposite ends of the spectrum of obnoxiously stuck-up or dingy. I would totally come back again and try their whiskey selection. I didn't order any drinks this night, but boo got a beer on tap.
author: Jodi H.

description:
Pretty decent spot to grab drinks after work in the city. The vibe of the place fits well into the hip bar scene serving the SF techie population. I enjoy it, but may not cater to everybody's taste. 

I came in a group of ~7 around on a Friday afternoon and we had to flag someone down to order food and check on food several times. Granted it was busy and very loud inside the bar, the fact that it took 10 minutes to order some tater tots and another 20 to actually get them after following up with 2 different people about the order was a bit confusing. 

Drinks: Moderate craft beer selection. Wine and cocktails available too. 
Happy Hour: 3-7PM (M-F), $1 off beer and wine. 
Food: Garlic tater tots were tasty.
Price: Pretty good. Beer ends up being around $6-7 for craft and $4-6 for domestic/ imported.
Service: Overall experience was mediocre. Lacked attentiveness and friendliness. 

Overall: Not a bad choice if you are in the area. I wouldn't go out of my way to drop by next time, but wouldn't mind having a quick drink earlier in the afternoon before the after-work rush.
author: Catherine L.

description:
Huge props to their supporting of local non profits. Overall, a great spot for happy hour after work or late night spot. With their quality food and drink menus, you can find something for everyone in your crew. 

The local non-profit I support worked with Southside Spirit House for our fundraiser. Leilani was a super star to work with. They created a customized drink menu and were generous in profit sharing.

Food: 5 stars based on bar food :) You can't go wrong with the truffle tots - everyone loves those. Blackened shishito peppers are also a crowd-pleaser. I don't eat flat breads much but many of my friends love them.

Drinks 5 stars: Their cocktail concoctions are delicious. One of my favorites is the Maiden Lane. They also always have fresh grapefruit.

Service 5 stars: Everyone is incredibly friendly and helpful. As mentioned above also really support local efforts in the bay area. 

THANK YOU!!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Great spot for drinks in Soma! The space is inviting and modern, yet rustic feeling. While it's definitely busy and crowded, it doesn't feel oppressively so. There's a decent amount of seating with a variety of options -- long high top tables, smaller low tables, and bar seating -- which make it pretty versatile. I could see myself going here with a big group, a couple of friends or potentially a date. While my friend and I couldn't sit initially upon arriving, we did find seating after a few minutes. 

It's a bit loud so not a place to go if you're looking to be able to have an in-depth conversation with your companion. The bartenders were good about checking in with us for the most part, but were not as attentive when we tried to get their attention. 

The cocktails are well crafted and strong. I got a spicy whiskey drink that was very well made and delicious, with a good balance of flavors and spice. Prices weren't bad for cocktails in SF, either.
author: Christine G.

description:
Cool spot to get drinks after work! It's about a 5-7 minute walk from Montgomery Bart, so really convenient if you're trying to grab a quick drink before heading back home. I came here with a friend on a Thursday evening for the first time and was blown away by how big the space is compared to how it looks on the street.

There's a ton of room inside, and it's not hard to find seating. I got the Triple Voodoo lager on tap, which was really light (4.8%) and refreshing. They also have mini jenga on the tables so you won't be bored. The bar is really pretty - they have a really nice layout and it's aesthetically pleasing. The whole place has a rustic feel to it, but my only complaints are that the bartenders can be a little inattentive and you have to really shout during happy hour because it gets really loud.
author: Victoria L.

description: What I love about Southside is the ability to make reservations for medium to large groups. Tons of beer on tap and bottles. Food. The tater tots are a hit. The sliders are great too. Just a great spot after work for groups to imbibe and bite. Trivia night on Tuesday nights!  Can become quite crowded. That's why reservations are key!
author: Allie F.

description: Nice little bar in downtown. Has some great pizza!! (especially after a few hours at the bar)
author: Kevin D.

description:
Came here Saturday night a little before 12am and had such a fun time with my friends. The bar is small and slightly dead, but come with a group and you'll find things to keep you entertained. We played jenga all night until closing :P

The real reason for the 5 stars is because I lost my phone there that night and and went into panic mode. Tried calling, but they wouldn't answer their phones and they are closed on Sundays. My boyfie and I both e-mailed the two e-mails listed on their site and they both responded saying they will check on Monday. Fortunately, they go back to us and said they had it safe and sound :) They even provided a direct number to reach them so that also calmed my nerves. Thank you, Southside for being great samaritans!!!
author: Anna M.

description:
Terrible service. On a weeknight with not too many people in the bar, the bartender took ages to take my friends order. In fact she went around to other people who had arrived way after us first. After that the person cleaning took away my friend's glass before she was done. She had to ask him to bring it back. A few minutes later they did the same thing with my beer. 

Come on Southside Spirit House - you can do better than this.
author: Pranav K.

description:
Great place for happy hours! This place has a very open floor plan with some booths/tables scattered around the sides.

The drinks are great and they also have some smaller plates as well! It usually is pretty busy here, though.
author: James D.

description:
Great Mezcal drinks, and one where they smoke hickory and then mix the drink in the smoke. Cool as hell.

Food is pretty good. The "flatbread" feels more like a basic pizza. Tots are the best and then chicken tenders
author: Harley M.

description: GREAT bar in SoMa to just shoot the sh*t. Clean, yet somewhat rugged with Sam Flores artwork gracing the walls. Bartenders are super friendly and not afraid to chop it up, and I usually come around 4-5pm and it's not too crowded. Love this place!!!
author: Genevieve M.

description:
Came here for after-work drinks with a few friends on a Wednesday - it was already crackin' at 5:30 pm, so come early if you want to secure a table! There's lots of room to stand around, though, with a decent amount of elbow room. 

This place is relatively new to the area (located where Eve used to be - their gold-embossed entryway serves as a little reminder), but they've made fantastic use of the space. Borrowing from the naturally-lit, open-air, trendy-but-rustic-but-priced-more-on-the-trendy-side developments in SOMA in the past couple years, Southside fits right in. They've got a solid list of house cocktails, beers on draft, and shareable snackables like flatbreads, fries, and tots. 

I went with a $6 beer (which may be a $1 off during HH? not positive) and snagged a few flatbread slices from a buddy. Both were great! The vibe is chatty and friendly without getting too loud, and the skylight adds a relaxed glow to the space, which is decked out with original artwork and wooden detailing.

Falling somewhere between a chic bar and a lodge, Southside is a solid spot to grab a couple drinks and catch up with folks. We only stuck around for about an hour, but if you grab a table near the bar you could easily pass an evening here. 

It's hard to compete with the Tuesday Happy Hour at Kate's right next door, but on another weeknight I'd happily return. Cheers!
author: Laura B.

description: I came here for happy hour on a Monday and it wasn't crowded at all. We got a seat at the booths along the wall and ordered at the bar. I got a whiskey ginger and my mom got a gin and tonic. Both were well-made and it was during happy hour so we got $1 off. Not a bad deal! Overall, the bar has a pretty chill vibe and it doesn't get crowded until later so going early will guarantee you a seat. I'd be back to try some of their house cocktails too!
author: Pooja C.

description:
We came here because we were looking for a place to hang out before going clubbing at Temple across the street and Southside Spirit House was a great place to do so. This bar has a great atmosphere with it's wooden finish on the walls and floor as well as cool but subtle decorations like the cassette wall that make you feel like you're in an old-timey saloon. They have a great beer and cocktail selection with average prices for the area and the bartenders are prompt. 

The seating is a mix between couches along the wall and high bar tables with seating at the bar as well and the restrooms are decently clean. The music was a little bit too loud for a bar to have a nice conversation but it was also a Friday night so maybe to be expected.
author: Michael Y.

description:
Went to happy hour here the other night. I ordered the Maiden Lane (whisky, fresh strawberries, lemon juice, and ginger beer) which was good, not as good as I was expecting but still good. 

I really liked the space of the bar but it was completely packed when we went, it was hard to even move. I'd definitely be interested in coming back here when it's not so busy!
author: Ilana B.

description:
Cool after work vibe right now at 6pm.  Nice drink menu with beers and original cocktails..tables have jenga.  The Top Rope is a good sipper with a ginger beer flavor.  

Also lots of things on the walls to look at and start conversations with if you need to!
author: Joshua T.

description:
In an attempt to visit all the cool bars in the SF Financial District, I was excited to finally cross Southside off my list of bookmarks, and it was well-worth the wait! My friend was waiting for me at the bar, which I'm thankful for, because it was fairly crowded for a Wednesday after-work happy hour.

The bartenders are so sweet. When I took bartending classes, I'm glad that my instructor emphasized the importance of etiquette to their patrons. Any bartender who takes the time to say "I'll be right with you." even if I'm not in a rush, deserves praise and a slightly bigger tip. Over the course of our stay, I ordered the Toki Koki and the Resurrection cocktails. So good! Perfectly strong and well-crafted. The Toki Koki was a strong scotch drink, while the Resurrection was a fruity vodka drink. Either way, this place definitely earns an A+ for its cocktails.

As for food, there's a limited menu, but it's way more fulfilling than plain bar food. I ordered chicken tenders, which came with a delicious BBQ sauce. The other sauce, which was my only complaint, was disgustingly watery. It tasted like someone forgot to shake the bottle of Ranch dressing. I should have asked for another batch. The chicken itself was very tender and tasty, not dry and overfried like most chicken tenders served at a bar.

In my mind, I saved the best FiDi bar for last. There's lots of seating here, which makes it even better. Top notch drinks and simple but tasty food. Southside has become one of my favorites, and I look forward to coming back here again!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Southside Spirit House is one of the better options for drinking and decompression in the Financial District. It's perfectly situated next to a lot of large companies with plenty of thirsty folks who like to work hard/play hard. If I worked down there more regularly, I could see this being a top option for a place to go.

I ordered a Glenlivet on the rocks and took a low table surrounded by cushion seats near the front window.  It's hard ti mess up straight scotch and they certainly did not. My friends ordered cocktails and seemed satisfied. The atmosphere is warm, loungy, great for the HH crowd. Some of the paintings and decorations were hip and interesting as well. 

It can get pretty loud and crowded during HH or a busy weekend night, or even after a game at AT&T. Keep that in mind as you look for the proper ratio of ambiance for your drinking needs.
author: Alex L.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday night for trivia. The only thing I had was a mojito, which was AMAZING. Their drinks are strong and very well made.

A couple things to note if you plan on coming for trivia night:

1. RESERVE A TABLE! My friends and I didn't put in a reservation, and the place was packed, so we had to sit pretty far away from the speaker. 
2. No matter where you sit, the speaker is VERY hard to hear. A table opened up so we moved closer, and it was still so hard to hear. I would recommend for them to put up a temp wall to separate the space just for trivia night to fix this issue.
3. The last 2 rounds, music & celebrity identification, are the best rounds! You don't have to worry about not hearing the speaker.
4. I don't like their grading policy. You're supposed to switch with another group, which was hard because we were so far away. I would recommend having the speaker grade everyone during the last 2 rounds. Also, the bar should announce this rule before the game starts.

I'll probably come back!
author: Remy B.

description: Southside Spirit House is a super packed bar if you go for Friday happy hour. They have some tables with stools you can reserve, and some pretty good cocktails. It will be LOUD in here, difficult to walk around, and you'll have to wait for drinks, but it's worth checking out once. At least there is a good amount of bathroom stalls for the ladies so we didn't have to wait in line for very long! It'll be difficult to find parking in this area though, since they have some construction going on, there is limited street parking, and a ton of stop and go traffic in front of the bar during happy hour time.
author: Amy D.

description:
I came here for the first time during their New Years eve celebration with my girlfriends because one of my friends was a huge fan of one of the DJs playing that night. I had no idea where this place was and never heard of it, but for $40 I was down for the open bar for an hour, good drinks and great company so it sounded like a great plan! We had a ton of fun dancing and definitely took advantage of the free champagne and food they were giving out that evening. Service was great and for a small place with a dance floor, it was a great spot to hang out and celebrate the new year.

I recently came back this past weekend for a girl's night out and surprisingly on a Saturday night, it was pretty quiet and low-key. We got their moscow mule & shared their bar tater tots for $5 and sat by where the dance floor was. There was a decent amount of people but it wasn't as crowded as the last time I was here. I don't think it's a spot for a big night out, but it's perfect for after-work drinks with coworkers or just having a casual catch-up with friends.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Great place for happy hour! They have a nice selection of beers and mixed drinks, and their truffle tater tots are some of my favorite happy hour food. I always eat too many of them.

There are enough tables and chairs so that you can sit and not feel totally claustrophobic. The only downside is that it can be a little bit loud at times, so it may not be the best place if you're trying to meet someone for a first date for happy hour because you might not be able to hear each other. If you are hanging out with coworkers after work or want to catch a game on TV, this is a good place.

I wouldn't trek across town to go to this bar, but I'd come back if I was in the area.
author: Christina L.

description:
Their HH deals are pretty good and drink specials chalk-displayed on the wall are reasonable for SOMA. I always order something from that list or the $10 Jameson shot & Miller High Life combo. The cocktails are also good, though unsure if it's me but many drinks are either strong or light, not really in between. I like it that way - an option as some nights I'm thirsty and other nights I know eventually will get KO.

The bar food is surprisingly good as well. We usually get the bacon flat-bread pizza and the tater tots. There are also TVs on local sports teams, or Jenga to enjoy, when you're in a group. However, this is rarely a destination. It might be because of the B&T crowd or transplants from the Marina vibe? Or perhaps how loud it gets.

Milestone: the 7,000th Funny vote's review!
author: Peter L.

description:
Came here for Friday happy hour since it's only a block from work. Happy hour deal is $1 off beer, wine, and well drinks. It was super crowded, but luckily we snagged some seats on the couch. 

The truffle oil tater tots are pretty expensive, at $9 a bucket, yet worth every penny. So much flavor and the Parmesan cheese on top is a nice touch. 

The raucous atmosphere made it feel like I was at a sports bar even though there was only 1 or 2 TVs.
author: Edward W.

description:
Have come here a quite a few times now because it's so conveniently located and they also do trivia every Tuesday night. 

Their food is ok. I'm not the biggest fan of their pizza; I find the dough to be a little soft but it's not bad. Their tots are awesome though! Drizzled with truffle oil and parmesan yum! 

They also have awesome drinks. I've only gotten to try some of their cocktails but they've all been great. They have pretty great happy hour deals at $5/pint. 

Music is good and not deafeningly loud. General ambience is more on the classy than divey but it's not overly pretentious. Overall, a great place to grab a drink after work!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I have been to this bar four times with coworkers for Happy Hour because it is convenient.  The pizza, tater tots, and drinks are great. The reason why I don't feel they deserve four stars is due to the horrible service of their bartender John T.  Everytime he serves me and my coworkers he is unfriendly, dismissive, and takes our food and drinks before we are finished.  

Tonight, at around 7 p.m. he threw away our pizza we had ordered ten minutes before and he claimed it was because there was a napkin on the tray.  We tried to stop him and he looked us in the eye and said it looked finished so he was throwing it away.  He also tried to throw away our tater tots basket and we literally had to pry it out of his hands so we could finish them.

Of course my friend left  him zero tip.
author: Emilia G.

description:
Went there for my class' weekly happy hour (we were 8-10 people). Staff didn't even acknowledge us so we proceeded to seat ourselves. Staff was very cold and unhelpful and told us that every single table at the bar was already reserved (even though the place was empty as we went there at 5pm). And that sitting a big group at the bar would very inconvenient. So, we just left... and probably never coming back again... 

I wish I could review their beers, because they looked pretty good, but we didn't get to try any so...
author: Rim K.

description:
After meeting up with friends next door, Peter L and I decided to check out Southside Spirit House since I've never been. It was Wednesday, August 19th around 8pm. We ordered a couple rounds of drinks and snacks.

Drinks:
*Caged heat: dickel whisky, lemon, tamarind, cardamom, ghost pepper ($11)
*Vieux roi (old king): great king street scotch, punt e mes, chateau du tariquet armagnac, galliano ($12)
*Maiden lane: dickel whisky, fresh strawberries, lemon juice & ginger beer ($11)
*Smoky serpent: peet monster scotch, salers aperitif liquor, cardamaro amaro, carpano bianca, cardamom bitters, orange bitters ($13)

I got the Caged heat and Maiden lane. The Caged heat was good. A nice spicy finish at the end. The Maiden lane was a little sweeter than I thought it would be with all the ginger beer. A little too light for me.

Food:
*Truffle tots: tossed with garlic, truffle oil, parmesan cheese, served with house made blue cheese dressing ($8)
*The buck wild: bacon, pepperoni, sausage, marinara, mozzarella and wild arugula tossed in garlic oil and salt (originally $15, $5 off for Wayback Wed)

I loved the Truffle tots. Crispy and cheesy with subtle truffle aroma and flavor. They have their version of happy hour called Wayback Wednesdays on Wed, 9pm-1am. Specials are $10 flatbread pizzas and $5 tater tots. I was hungry and didn't want to wait until 9p, so we ordered the tots before HH started. Waited to order the flatbread, so we got $5 off. Flatbread was more like a pizza. It was good.

The whole time we played Jenga and I failed miserably. I lost every time. But hey, I had fun.

Great place to chill, play games, drink and eat.
author: Elena N.

description:
Cute place to catch up after work! We got there a little later in the evening which was great because we avoided all the after work happy hour rush! The appetizers to share were pretty large and the service was speedy and great! 

My only negative is that it is a little out of the way and in quite a random location but will visit again soon.
author: Rachel N.

description:
Came here after work for a few drinks and snacks.  It got pretty packed by 6 o'clock.  Surprisingly for a tuesday, you could barely find an open seat.  I ordered a moscow mule which came in a mason jar?!  It was ok, not too much ginger beer flavor to be honest.  

For snacks we ordered the tots and the margarita "flatbread" which is a pizza.  Don't be fooled by fancy words here.  I guess it was pretty good after a few drinks!  Also, the tots had no trace of truffle whatsoever.  

Overall, pretty normal bar scene and food.  I don't think I'd go out of my way to frequent this place but it's a good location if you work in the area.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Chill place for happy hour, can get crowded but that adds to the vibe. Good beer options and a convenient location.
author: Taimur A.

description:
Oh, Southside Spirit House, you stole my heart. Options on options paired with class, this is a perfect chill/not too aggressive bar!

What else can you ask for at a bar, or in life?!?! Right in the SOMA area and across Temple Night club is the wonderful Southside spirits. With plentiful seating and dim lights, they also offer Loaded Tots. Flatbread Pizza. Great Beer selection. Craft cocktails. And a $10 Jameson plus beer combo. Personally would eat hundreds of their yummy tots if I could! 

Southside Spirit House is great for a drink after a long work week or just a casual night with friends. Their bartenders and staff are super nice and really know how to make their drinks!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: Came here to meet up some friends for drinks!  The atmosphere was nice and it wasn't too packed when I went. There are TV screens on top of the bar for the game and has tables along the opposite wall to accommodate everyone. Tater tots were delicious.. i mean who doesn't like garlic tots? I also got the old fashioned here and it was made really well. Definitely will be coming back to try some more food and get some more old fashionds :)
author: Samee M.

description: Sweet spot to check out around the financial district. Surprisingly cheap cocktails and good music
author: Leila S.

description:
Going stupid dumby and hyphy. This place is a super crowded and great place for a corporate or personal happy hour.  In the heart of the Financial district right off of 2nd street.

Super friendly bar tending staff. I wouldn't recommend this place for intimate events but more so for events where where you want to stand up and mingle.

They have great flatbread pizzas for a snack to accompany your drinks.
author: Kunal T.

description: A fantastic place for drinks and late night food. Their tater tots, flatbread and classic cocktails are to die for. The staff is very nice and welcoming and they have also have games like Jenga to pass time. This place is generally crowded on weekdays (due to office rush). They have DJ nights,happy hour and Trivia nights which are so much fun!
author: Nikita J.

description: Love this little bar because it's a little out of the way so it's not super crazy. They have games to play (giant Jenga) and yummy cocktails in mason jars. The employees were chill and they also have food/snacks. This may be my new favorite chill bar.
author: Katie P.

description:
Located conveniently close to Montgomery BART station (only a 7 minute walk!), Southside Spirit House is a perfect place for happy hour with friends, coworkers, or even a hot date.

There's lots of bar seating, couches, and wooden tables to drink at. I really dig the vibe here! 

- good selection of beer, wine, and cocktails
- happy hour from 3-7pm ($1 off drinks)
- TVs so you can catch the games
- flat bread pizza ($13)  is delicious!
- can make reservations for party of 12+

Cocktails are around $11-13. You have to try the Maiden Lane - whiskey, lemon juice, strawberries, and ginger beer served in a cute little mason jar. 

Will definitely be back and back again for drinks!
author: Christine S.

description:
Southside Spirit House is usually my go-to spot for team happy hours. I usually email them to reserve a booth area that fits up to 15 people; you'll just need to give them your credit card for the reservation and spend a minimum of $300. 

They have great happy hour (Monday - Friday 3pm to 7pm) and food to snack on. Some of my favorites are their truffle tater tots, jalapeno mac and cheese, and their Foghorn Leghorn BBQ pizza. Come early (around 5pm) because Southside can get crowded.
author: Cindy A.

description:
Came here for a work happy hour last week. We took a lyft but this place is hard to find considering its right near a construction area so beware! 

They have some pretty good bites and drinks as well as a good amount of seating area either on barstools or small comfy chairs. Lighting is nice, we came here around 7 and it was pretty packed already. I ordered a Moscow Mule and also tried their Maiden Lane which consisted of strawberries, lemon, ginger beer and I think tequila. It was soooo yummy!! Their truffled tots and pizza!! Service is good too but since they were pretty busy they did forget to place one of my orders until I asked them where my second drink was.  Also, it's really hard to hear or have a conversation in here! For some reason it's just really loud and the next day I woke up with a sore throat from screaming the night before. 

Overall, it was a fun night. Can't comment on the price since it was on our work tab but from the looks of it, seemed average in price compared to other bars.  Nice bar if you're already in the area but I don't see myself coming back too often since I don't frequent this area much.
author: Shelly W.

description: South side has great good and great drinks. You must try their tots! They come with Parmesan cheese and a delicious garlic dip (maybe not the best for first dates). The my cousin vinny pizza is one of my all time favorite flat breads. They have tvs and will show games. The only issue is this place gets packed, which isn't always ideal after a long day at the office. The people there are cool though, and you can meet new people if you are trying too. It's right next store to Kate obriens, so I recommend checking out both of them since it's convenient. The bar tenders are cool, and I love the beer on tap.
author: Mollie H.

description: Excellent spirit house / bar!  The Old Fashioned was delicious and the Caged Heat was very interesting and good as well.  Knowledgeable bar tenders.  Great craft cocktails
author: Sande G.

description: Southside is our office local and we love it! The cocktails are so good...try The Southside or Hooker's Boot!!....and there's a great selection of beers on tap. PLUS, there is Jenga at each table. They serve bars bites and pizzas if you're in the mood.
author: Corinne C.

description:
I do really like  this place with its selection of drinks and the games and the room.  It's really close to work and for me on the way to the transfer bay busses.
  
Here is a big but. 

Man it gets packed.  It's live and if you like that packed bar scene.  This is definitely for you. It was good til there was too much people. 

I still recommend the place though.   It really seem to do well. 

The big plus obviously is the game is on. (They have 2 screens) 

They also have Jenga on the tables.  That somebody who will rename nameless was writing his own quote on the Jenga pieces.
author: Homer S.

description: Amazing place! decided to try this after work when an out of the country coworker was in town. They accommodated us very nicely, there was plenty of room to spread out and the service was amazing. We will be back.
author: Carol L.

description:
used to be decent, now a terrible place.


I first came here about 2 years ago and had a drink and a pizza. both weren't bad. I just came here last night and wow what a difference that 2 years can do. my drink was awful, the pizza was hard as a rock, and the service was absolutely terrible. It was quiet on a saturday night and yet the bartender didn't acknowledge me for at least 20 minutes. I definitely will not come here again.
author: Allan M.

description:
Nothing too exciting or special about this place
Gets too crowded in the afternoon and they don't have a cooling system
Drinks are on the high end of pricing
author: Jad A.

description:
A few colleagues and I came here after a networking event nearby. I really like the layout. There were quite a few people there for a weeknight. Most of the crowd were fellow single professionals. The bartenders are friendly. The drink prices are average for the city. The floors and tables are clean. 

The food was unexpectedly tasty for a bar menu. I was expecting something simple to nibble on. A few of us orders several things:
Deviled Eggs
Truffle Tater Tots
Braised Beef Tacos
Arugula Salad 

To my surprise, everything was sooooo delicious.
author: Laurina S.

description: I've always liked this place but was treated extremely rudely today by someone claiming to be the manager. There was a special listed on the menu for Wednesdays for the flatbread and tots for happy hour. I was overcharged and when I brought this to their attention. He told me it starts at 10pm. I went to grab the menu and showed him that it was no where on there. I got no apology or any sort of action to fix the issue but was rather told I was going to be ignored. I did not want to cause any issue onsite but wanted to spread the word. My credit card company will be hearing about this shady practice for overcharging what was advertised and not correcting the incorrect charge.
author: Podar W.

description: Came here on a Friday after work for happy hour and was able to snag two seats at the bar. Fair warning - it is LOUD in there but Jacob was an awesome bartender and we had fun chatting with him and sharing whiskey preferences. We also ordered the chicken fingers which came with a variety of dipping sauces - yum!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Been coming here a ton after work for happy hour! Beer & wine are a dollar off and it's such a great environment!

I've tried their Racer 5 & Golden State Hard Cider and both are super tasty! My friends and I usually get there around 5 and grab a table before the rush around 5:30-6 come in and we grab a game!
 
Most recently, I actually tried their tater tots w/ parmesan cheese & omg it was delicious. Might have been because I was half hungry/half drunk but it was crunchy and each piece had a small piece of cheese melted on! (along w/ some ranch on the side)
author: Carrie L.

description:
I came with my team for happy hour at 5PM on a Turn Up Tuesday and there was still plenty of room. We kicked back with beers and cocktails and played some very intense games of jenga.

Ramble On (11) - Very light and refreshing gin-based cocktail with blueberry-basil syrup. Highly recommend for those of you that like fruitier dranks.

Truffle Tots (8) - Tater tots are easily my favorite form of the versatile potato. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside - just how tater tots should be. Tossed in garlic and shaved parmesan, they are highly addictive. Definitely get this!!

Very chill environment with friendly staff, yummy bites, and delicious drinks. I'll be back!
author: Lucy N.

description:
Came here on a Friday night after watching the Warriors dominate the Cavs in game 4 of the NBA finals! Woohoo! And I'm glad to say it wasn't too pack. Unfortunately we didn't make it to their happy hour. Nevertheless, what kept us busy throughout the night was their $10 deal of a shot of Jameson paired with 7oz of Miller High Life, which wasn't too bad.

But what was definitely worth coming here for was their truffle tots. Hands down, the best tots in the city as they are always cooked to perfection. It's crisp and warm and will surely melt in your mouth. It's definitely a must try!
author: Denzell S.

description:
I work nearby and I always see Southside filled up to the max.  Naturally I thought that it would be a good place to have my coworker's birthday celebration.  After work, on a Monday, I figured that it shouldn't be that full or crowded and that we can find seating easily.  Also, if we ordered food, then it shouldn't take that long for us to get it.

Getting here at 5pm, it wasn't full at all and we got seats easily.  From their list of draft beers, half of them were not available for some odd reason.  That was slightly irritating as I wanted one of those beers that they were out of.  I had to settle for one that they did have.

We ordered food, a pizza and a lot of tater tots and a salad.  The pizza took a long time...way too long if you ask me.  How hard is it to put cheese and stuff on a pizza?  The tater tots came out but again, way too long for a place that wasn't too busy.  As for the salad?  It never came...we asked the server who was running food and he said that they don't have a salad order pending.  What?  After getting one of the bartender's attention, they immediately said that they would refund the charge including the tip that we left.  OK...great...but how about an explanation and an apology?  Never got either one.  It also didn't help that the food runner had an attitude as well, not being helpful or accommodating when we were asking about our yet to be delivered food.

It seems almost laughable that these amateur hour type of things happen in such a seasoned business as Southside.  Sure they can still make a good cocktail and they have very comfortable and wide open seating, but the customer service experience that we had was well below average.  If this happens on a slow Monday night, then why should I ever trust that this place runs any better on nights with way more customer traffic?

I definitely owe my coworker an apology for choosing to go to such an unworthy place for celebrating his birthday.
author: Ben H L.

description:
So we are visiting from San Diego. Not only did we get kicked out once from our seats, but we got kicked out twice. The second was to a group of guys who came in after us and sat in the same spot that we got kicked out of the first time :| 

Edit: The waiter Scottie went out of his way to make up for our prior experience and it actually worked! He let us explain why we were upset and he expressed his perspective on the situation, and then we came to a mutual understanding. He was great and made up for it x10.
author: Cream C.

description:
I have hazy memories of this place...because I don't know how I got home after a boozy after-work happy hour one day. It was fun though, I really liked the place and more recently I was able to re-visit for another after-work happy hour, but this time I restricted myself to 1 beer only!

The place is predestined for the SoMa tech worker crowd. It's close to many offices, and the vibe is casual. There's high-tables where people can sit and chat and even sample their food. There's plenty of standing room, which is especially important when hordes of work teams come in one group at a time!

Food-wise, this place doesn't do gourmet, but solid bar food, which I should've eaten more of on my first visit!
author: Uli B.

description: Great atmosphere! Happy hour deal wasn't the best (Only $1 off beer, wine, and well drinks). Would recommend getting the mozzarella balls and a table where you can play Jenga!
author: Jenny H.

description:
Came here for dinner and drinks with a couple friends. I opened my tab by ordering a cocktail, the "SOMA Swizzle". The bartender had a very cocky "dgaf" attitude from the get-go. He was very slow to make my drink, ignored people at the bar while shooting the shit and helping serve his friends instead. He also gave my friend shit for asking for 3 glasses of water. 

I went back a few minutes later to put in a pizza order with the same bartender. He gave me a number and I went back to my table. I waited for 40 minutes for my pizza before asking another bartender to check on it for me. My friends had ordered before me and waited a while before getting their food so I didn't really think anything of it. He comes back and tells me the bartender never put the order in. He apologized and told me if I still wanted it they would comp it. So I asked for it to go. He brought me my credit card back right after, and didn't charge me for the cocktail or pizza. He also offered me a beer while I waited for the pizza. 

This bartender totally redeemed my experience, as I walked out not paying a dime for 2 drinks and a pizza. Giving 2 stars for the other terrible bartender, and me and my friend's wasted time. Would consider going back because of the way this terrible service was handled.
author: Kelly H.

description:
The last four digits of Southside Spirit House's number spells L-U-S-H. Any place that has "Lush" in their number, I'm immediately a fan of.

Apparently, so are a lot of people because Southside Spirit House was CRACKING last Friday during happy hour!

Formerly Eve, Southside has transformed into a low-key bar/lounge with a Western ambiance: wooden furnishings, wooden bar, buffalo paintings, wooden floors and wooden tables (I miss the sultry vibe of Eve). It reminded me a bit of John Colins except with a ton of communal tables and several flat screen TVs. Come to later find out that Southside is actually the sister bar of John Colins (they also owned Eve).

Although Southside did away with Eve's clubby-ness, they do have DJs spinning Motown at night. No more hip hop (BOO!) so they'll probably attract a different kind of crowd on the weekends than what Eve use to. 

All artisan cocktails are $11. During happy hour (Monday - Friday 3 pm to 7 pm), it's a $1 off and during "spirit hours" (Monday - Friday 11 pm-2 am), it's $2 off. 

Cocktail menu: http://bit.ly/13m41Ps

I got the Ramble On ($11): http://bit.ly/12k81o0 which is perfect for gin lovers especially if you like blueberries. It was a bit on the weak side for me but then again,  I'm a huge lush and I like my cocktails extra stiff. 

Sadly, it was too crowded to try anything on their food menu ($6-$12) but they totally had me at Truffle Popcorn, Steak Tartare, Beer Braised Corned Beef and Flat Bread Pizza! I will have to try their food next time especially since the kitchen closes at 1 am; just in time for sloshed eats!

Food menu: http://bit.ly/16sHxlJ

Ladies, it's a total cockfest in there with a lot of well-dressed lads. Not that I was looking...just merely an observation.

Pro-tip: The tilted mirror above the bar will give you an aerial view of the crowd. Don't get caught creeping now!  ;)
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I loved this bar. While it was pretty packed, it was still fun. I think it was the combination of the awesome Manhattan I had and the tabletop jenga that hooked me. 

I must note too, it was a good looking crowd of young professionals. so if you're looking for love, you might find it in all the right places here.

I was surprised that they had a featured drinks board with a tasty looking negroni on it, but alas, when I ordered it, the bartender said they were out of one of the ingredients. What a tease! Still, I'd come back... for love or another great cocktail and maybe even a negroni the next time!
author: Rachel C.

description: So loud and busy - festive - almost douchey, but not. Good bar food. Expensive Manhattan.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Great place!

So I went with a friend last night to this bar, the decor of the bar were nice and inspired me with bath mirrors. Normally at bars the bathrooms are awful, this one was not, I did see someone clean it twice when I was there (thank the bathroom God). So because it was a Saturday and being in the financial district is was pretty empty but I didn't mind because it gave my friend and I a chance to talk and play Jenga. 
Also, I'm a huge fan of Moscow mules and I must say the bartender made it to perfection, presentation of the drink was super cute as it mason jar.All the drinks were well priced, and they had a DJ. Noise level was perfect, still could have a conversation. Over all great atmosphere, and will be back again.
author: Cassandra G.

description:
IM A FAN!!

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place

Great interior.

Plenty of seating and free reservations on tables for a big group! Just email the contact person listed on the website. 

I emailed the HR person and she reserved my friends a great seating area with the couch and tables. Perfect for my friend's bday!

Saturday nights are the best -- buy 2 cocktails, get 1 pizza FREE. Yes, FREE!

Not just plain cheap pizza....more like fancy organic style pizza you can find at Nopa and Delfina! 

My favorite was the truffle mushroom pizza. My goodness. the smell of the pizza was so intoxicating that my friends and i just soaked in the smell! SOO good!

definitely coming back here again :)
author: Carol Y.

description:
Hands down the best Corpse Reviver #2 I have had so far. It was strong, yet balanced with a good range of flavor and depth. I would gladly order this again. 

Overall Thoughts

Southside is quickly becoming my go to spot!
author: Eddie W.

description:
This is a pretty chill place to meet up with fellow friends and associates who work in the Montgomery/Downtown area.  This was my first time here and it was for a friend's birthday that was midweek.

They were playing The Shining on the screens above and there was enough commentary from the crowd around.  It was mostly tech dudes/start up company people so it really wasn't the crowd I enjoy being around; but hey, it seemed everyone was having a good time.  I may be wrong; but this is the crowd I'm suspecting you can expect here on a regular basis.

Their happy hour is $1 off beer, wine, and well drinks.  Typical priced but they did seem to have a heavy hand (which I completely support).  It got pretty packed around 6PM but not uncomfortably so.  It did take awhile for me and my friends to order drinks at the bar; when we ordered there was only one bar tender on duty.   I'm not sure if another bartender came for support eventually.

The food was the usual bar food; tater tots (recommend) and pizza (meh, nothing too exciting) paired with table top Jenga proved to be a great evening with friends.

Overall, I'd say this is a good spot if you're near the area.  I wouldn't venture out to come here if I lived far.  I personally didn't find anything amazingly unique about the place but there definitely weren't any misses in terms of the atmosphere, food, or drinks (just the crowd, I suppose).  First time here but I don't anticipate myself planning on coming here again (unless I get summoned to meet up with friends who happen to be in this area).  Not a miss, not a hit; but you won't go wrong coming here.
author: Jared F.

description: Fun, funky, small bar right next to Kate Obriens.  Good scene - awesome drinks after work
author: Nici F.

description:
I finally made it in to check out the remodeled bar & I absolutely love SSH. I had been to the old Eve & can say Leilani has outdone herself with the revamp. Everything from the reclaimed wood to the cassette tape wall oozes appeal. It's also much brighter so I can see what I'm drinking & the people I'm with. The vibe on a Friday night was lively, seemed like a good after work crowd. Their location is easy within the SoMa area. Now on to the real star of the joint - the drinks. 

SSH offers a fantastic cocktail menu which doesn't surprise me one bit as Leilani knows her stuff in the mixology department. Being the whiskey gal that I am, I opted for the Caged Heat: whiskey, lemon, cardamom, tamarind (grabbed my attention), & ghost pepper. A little spice makes everything nice. This drink was everything I hoped it would be & not sweet. I just can't do sweet drinks. I was also able to sip the Resurrection & Maiden Lane. Both were equally as good as mine.  

Unfortunately I wasn't able to try any of their delicious food because we had dinner reservations. I will say that I've heard from a few sources that their food goes beyond bar food & is as good as their drinks. So, I will have to come back & update my review once I've tried the food. If you want a good vibe & tasty cocktail SSH is your place.
author: Elena F.

description:
This bar will light up the night life and lift your spirits during happy hour with $1 off every drink.  Don't forget to try their creative culinary pizzas and sliders.  The Mission pizza with truffled mushrooms or the pork belly sliders are sure to please your palate and satisfy your appetite before you play drunken Jenga!

The staff is friendly and helpful.  Reserve a table or booth for large groups.  Parking is ample on the street or nearby lots.  I'll be back to be spirited away!
author: Jenny L.

description: Cool spot to go for after work drinks. Nice drink menu, good cocktails but a little too loud when there's too many people.
author: Sophia J.

description: I used to come here when it was Eve. I love more than anything that the tiles that spell Eve are still at the entrance. A lot has changed and its for the better. Updated space now drawing in the techies and soma residences. Food order of margarita pizza was disappointingly burned due to new stove renovation I believe. Appreciate the waiter for giving us a discount did waiting for the food for so long. Good choice of drinks and cocktails along with some beers. My favorite parts of the night included orders of tater tots with grated cheese and Tuesday trivia night. Ambiance hits the spot here but food improvement definitely needed.
author: Linda L.

description:
I remember stumbling into this bar before it was Southside and leaving immediately after having a car bomb. Nice to see that it's a swanky new bar!

Great location! (Right next to Kate O'Brien's and across the street from Temple/Ki). It seems to always be packed but it isn't too difficult to get a drink. If it is, you can head next door and grab a brewski and wait for the crowd to subside.

What I'd come back for:

- Deviled eggs (yum)
- Gentleman Jack
- Friendly and attentive bartenders

Another chill bar in the city.
author: Kat C.

description: They don't clean their restrooms. The entire place smells of puke. We told the bartender about it. The lady who came out to our table said she knows about the smell. We thought someone puked at our table but she said it was from the restroom. So why not clean it if you know about it?!! Disgusting, I didn't even put my bag down.
author: Van C.

description:
I had one of the greatest times here. There is happy hour, which is posted in chalk on the board.

A group of us were here to watch the Giants world series 2014 game 6. I was obviously expecting a win, which unfortunately didn't happen. My liver, however, was certainly winning. There are about 3 - 4 TVs with plenty of viewing room. Since it was such an important game, there was mostly standing room. On an "off day" there are plenty of tables.

The drinks are great, bartenders are friendly, food is satisfying (pizzas, truffle fries, oh my).

My only negative is that my moscow mule did not come in a copper mug. hmmmmph
author: Kailey O.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening for a drink & ended up having a blast. It's draws a lot of professionals in the FiDi so it's a pretty hip, classy crowd. Luckily, that's totally my vibe. Great seating, decor, and lounge area--but it gets pretty packed. 

I had the Maiden Lane, which is a solid mix for me. Bourbon & strawberries, all day for this wannabe suave dude. 

The flatbreads are pretty tasty too. Paired with a cocktail (or two)....this bar a great place to chill at before heading out for other adventures.
author: Juan T. K.

description:
Drinks are good & solid draft/bottle selection. I went here with a group of coworkers, maybe almost 20 of us, and we sat in the couch area. We all were comfortable but you are sequestered from the bar. They had a bartender come take our orders & bring our drinks to is. 

We had the tator tots & chips with guac. Not the easiest thing to share in a big group but they ended up giving us plates & forks. 

It gets loud so we all weren't able to talk to everyone so we talked in groups instead. 

Small space = easy crowding. Get here early if trying to do happy hour during the week.
author: Constance D.

description: What? I only have one check in here? I've been here a few times though since it's close to my apartment and easy to get to otherwise by public transit. The pizza and truffle tots are so good, and easy shareable food for a night out with friends. I came here recently with my boyfriend and his coworkers and out of town guests. It was busy, but not too busy, so it was easy to claim a bunch of the low tables by the booths for the big group (though I don't know if that was just good timing). There was also Jenga there to play which, let's face it, is a bonus when a bunch of tipsy (and sober Lol) people are playing. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the drinks are good. I'll be seeing you there again soon!
author: Bianca C.

description: Good for drinks after work. It get's really packed after work. Would have loved to try the food items, but wasn't sure how to order given the chaos/frenzy of post-work individuals looking to imbibe.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Just writing to say that I'm a fan of the TATOR TOTS OOOOOOOOOOOOOMG. also had the margherita flatbread when drunk and it was cheesy and yummmmmmmmmmm. It took a while to come out, but it was the perfect food to eat while under the influence. i went back and got it sober, and it was alright lolololol. but the TATOR TOTS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This bar is conveniently located across the street from Temple, so I'll probably escape the club and chill here one day.
author: Annie S.

description:
a haiku for southside:

so many whiskeys
awesome bartenders and games
don't be the dd

thanks to buddy jason h. for the introduction. this will forever be known as the place where i first tried a pour of balvenie 30. pretty much died-and-gone-to-heaven status.
author: Yiwen S.

description:
I'm pretty reticent to divulge my fondness for what's become my go-to neighborhood bar, but I believe the word is already out. And anyway - I really should share the love. So fine, here goes!

Within a few blocks from my humble abode, I'm able to indulge in the finest of the couture cocktail movement - Local Edition, Rickhouse, Novela, Bloodhound, and House of Shields are all within stumbling (home) distance and all craft a solid cocktail. But only Southside Spirit House is my everything. It's never too crowded or overrun with fraternity types, the bartenders are cool and kind, and I feel just as comfortable bringing in a group of friends or a date as I do sidling up to the bar, solitary. You can kick it or kick back, depending on your mood.

Unlike a few spots I can think of, the bartenders don't give you the side-eye when you ask for something that isn't featured on the cocktail menu (read: zero attitude). And if you're not boozing, SSH has put together a decent craft beer list including my favorite, Hitachino White, as well as a small but thoughtful wine list. 

Hungry? The kitchen stays open 'til 1am every night which has saved me a couple of times... think casual American fare like flatbread pizzas, cheese and charcuterie plates, and sliders.

A great little slice of a cocktail bar that's never let me down!
author: Jelena Z.

description: There's nothing specifically bad about this bar, but there's nothing particularly above average either. The food should be skipped and the drink selection is standard.
author: Trevor B.

description: One of the best bars/eateries in S.F.!!! Amazing delicious classiest drinks. Not to mention the outstanding service!!!. The appetizers "pupus" are so "ono"... in hawaiian " lingo"! The owner Leilani and her associates are top notch!. Love this place! My friends and I can't wait to come back!
author: Nicole F.

description: Good place to come for happy hour, albeit a bit sweaty.
author: Lola P.

description: I love this place!  It has a cool atmosphere, good drinks, and friendly bartenders.  What else could you ask for?  I'm a vegetarian, but my friend who is a chicken sandwich connoisseur, loved the chicken sandwich.  I've been to trivia Tuesday once and really enjoyed it.  Check it.
author: Christi B.

description:
I have no idea how I wound up here. It certainly wasn't by my doing. I think my SF world-weary friend sent me in this direction after tiring of listening to me complain about my meal. Ever the old-time friend, he knows that a surefire way to shut me up is to get a good beverage in me. The cocktail of the evening was the Maiden Lane, a delightful blend of bourbon, strawberries, ginger beer, and lemon juice. Yes, I said 'delightful' when describing a bourbon drink. Somewhere in Kentucky, a burly man is anxious to beat me up. This drink would be worth it. Because a.) bourbon and b.) strawberries! Seriously? Yes. It's the perfect blend of tough and tender. Bourbon (just the word, not even the drink) will always be manly but when you pair it with a multitude of muddled strawberries...? Joy. In a glass. Imbibed many many times.

It's a good thing the vibe is so relaxed here. Between that, the drinks and the low-to-the-ground ottoman I was sitting on, upward/forward motion was something that just wasn't going to occur any time soon. Good for groups, come sit and stay a while in a craft cocktail bar that feels like home. Food? I can't say anything about that because 1.) my stomach was already full of bad decisions and 2.) who comes to a bar to eat (and then complains about it)?
author: Johnny T.

description:
Met up here with some friends, it's a lively place with a chill vibe. Clean, artsy, the food was fantastic, the staff were professional and friendly. 
Overall a good mix of both laid back and fun. Definitely would recommend and will be back!
author: Shelby D.

description:
Terrible. Not safe for females!

Want details? I asked the bartender for the address, because uber couldn't find it on the map location provided by GPS. His response - laughter, in my face as he poured drinks for his friends simultaneously. Then, he gave me a fake address. I asked for the manager. More laughter. His friends proceeded to berate me. Thank goodness I was not alone and asked my own friends for help. As I waited 20 more minutes for my uber, the bartender verbally attacked me as I sat silent at the bar. 

All I wanted was to go home. No one who worked there helped...they made it feel like I was trapped.
author: G_U U.

description:
Terrible, terrible service. So bad, in fact, that I can barely bring myself to say anything nice about the stuff that WAS good. Like the drinks: Holy Ghost, Gold Rush and Maiden Lane are all stellar choices. The Kale Salad was disgusting...way too much dressing that went everywhere, because they served it in a bizarre way. The Mission Flatbread Pizza with truffled mushroom was better, but I could have done without the caramelized onions. 

But yeah, bad service. I get that it was really crowded when we went, but they gave our order to the wrong table! And even when we flagged it to the waiter, he deliberately didn't apologize or offer to make up for it, and just gave us a lot of attitude about re-ordering it for us. Seriously?
author: Josephine L.

description:
I'm kind of a huge fan of this place. 

I came here for a friends bday party recently and I really, really love it! Aside from the crazy parking situation in this area on a weekend, this place is totally low key, but totally hopping.

I didn't know it used to be something else, but as Southside Spirit House, they serve little bites and great cocktails. They have long tables conducive to large parties, and are cool with you bringing your own desserts and snacks to share. Their cocktails seem pretty reasonably priced for being in SF and they have good service.

It was crowded and happening, but never so crowded you felt claustrophobic. They even have nice bathrooms, very themed ... I liked the ambiance overall and would not mind coming back!
author: Lorrie M.

description: Came here for a work get together and I was pleasantly surprised. The place can get pretty cramped though, but we were all able to sit down and get a spot together (we rolled pretty deep with about 10 people). The drinks were great. I had a few drinks, but I must say the garlic tater tots were absolutely delicious! We ordered a few of the pizzas as well, but most of the food on the menu were typical bar food just finger foods or appetizers. Overall, cool little spot close to my work! I definitely would recommend giving it a look for some solid drinks and good service.
author: James R.

description: Good food and drinks. Awesome service! Located in the center of business action.
author: M M.

description:
Great food and a great ambience!! It was crowded during happy hour, understandably, but we grabbed two bar seats in due time.  

I tried the "resurrection" cocktail... It was terrible!! Do not drink it!! I've never had a spicy drink before but this drink tasted like... Hmm, how can I describe it...pepper meets grass.  I did not drink even half of it. If this is what resurrection is like... No thanks, I'll just stay in heaven. 

However!! They made a great Moscow mule and I tried my friends tiki drink (forgot the actual name) and it was great! I must not be a big enough cilantro fan. 

Anyways. 

Avocado salad. Yum! Truffle tots! YES. 

I'll definitely be back. Too many delicious sounding drinks on the menu to let one bad seed of a concoction ruin things.
author: Kelly E.

description:
This place has a very rustic feel, speak easy, old style vibe to it. 

They serve some decent finger food and delicious drinks.

Autumn / Winter Old Fashion - Super smooth, with a hint of bitters, and a hit of sweetness, from I believe the maple syrup. I had a black cherry in my drink and I thought it was absolutely delicious.

They have a good selection of beers too.

Tater Tots are yummy, as are the flatbreads / pizzas. The food is a bit on the pricier side, I thought they were worth it! 

It can get pretty crowded here. There is bar seating, and a few tables. The tables are more community tables, unless you have a larger group. Come early, come often.

Recommended and I'll be back!
author: Kaje Y.

description:
As far as bars goes, this is definitely one of the best I've been to. 

We came on a Monday right when they opened with a friend who was in town from Germany. We had such a good time sitting at the long tables, playing Jenga. All of our drinks were delicious. I had the Ramble On and my husband ordered a whiskey drink. Later I ordered a beer and he had an Old Fashioned, which he says was the best one he's ever had. 

Drinks were a tad expensive, but what can ya expect. The happy hour was nice and took a $1 off our drinks. We didn't order any food, but I will definitely come back to this bar.
author: Kelli H.

description: Loved this bar! Forget about stuck up snooty bartenders at other SF cocktail joints. You won't find them here. I spoke to both bartenders that were working the night I was in and both were more than willing to chat about drinks and make recommendations. My favorite of the night was the Caged Heat. I'm a spicy cocktail fanatic and this one hit the mark. I tried 4 other drinks and sampled some friends as well. All of them were excellent. The place wasn't packed and you could actually have a conversation. We ordered a couple pizzas which were excellent and the lounge are couches were a great place for our group to funnel in and out of. Nothing bad to say about this place. I will absolutely be back.
author: Scotty C.

description:
1/18/2014

To drink:
Maiden Lane (dickel whisky, fresh strawberries, leon juice, ginger beer)
Ramble On (gin, fresh lime, fresh house blueberry-basil syrup)

The cherry on top was that our 2 drinks came with a whole flatbread pizza for free! (Based on recent Yelp reviews, it seems like this deal has sadly been taken away).

The music was really loud for a bar, so it was kind of difficult to have a conversation, and apparently they couldn't turn it down. Hopefully they fixed this for my next visit!
author: Christine C.

description:
This spot has changed ownership / identity so many times that I'm hopeful that this current ownership will stick around... because they have a good thing going!

Was here for a very dear colleague's "last day at work" drinks... open bar and food... good times!

Ambiance: a lot cleaner and brighter than when it was "Eve" - the one thing I noticed was that they weren't selling sushi / rolls in the front and they weren't refrigerated. See, a good thing already. Plus the decor is modern with hints of the south" 

Food: since we were a group ... we ordered a bunch of pizza: happy hippie flatbread... was my favorite! Tasty... crispy and really went well with my Amstel Light (yes I know...)

Overall... since it's just a couple of blocks from work... will probably visit again... but will probably try something other than an Amstel!
author: Cath M.

description:
This place is great for group happy hours or get togethers if you don't want to be stuck with one bill at the end of the night. They have great selection of bar bites, cocktails, good beer list, and a happy hour until 7pm. You order at the bar and they bring the food to your table. 

It's crazy crowded until 7 - 7:30pm on a weekday but after that, you'll get a whole table to yourself and will be able to hear each other talk.
author: Tatyana K.

description:
This place needs to update their cocktail menu online. Came for the Hooker boot cocktail and the bartender said he didn't have the right tequila to go with it. However, he made it anyway and warned that it would be spicer than normal,  which was true. It was a little too spicy, but I was warned.. I also tried the Terrence en llamas, not good at all. You should stick with beer here. I did like how they had 2 types of peak's organic beer, which is very hard to find here. 

This is a good space to hang out with friends, pretty empty most of the time. There's also board games and tvs. Stick with beer here and you'll be good.
author: Lisa T.

description:
LOVE THIS JOINT
(5 stars)

The vibe is something else!!!

-FOOD, great bar food with a nice twist
-COCKTAILS, pretty, tasty, and strong 
-PRICES, fair 
-SERVICE, awesome 
-AMBIANCE, art and tape wall are cool editions

My close friends are regulars. I frequent the scene from time to time. We been coming here for about a solid yr since the name change. Katherine is one of the best bartenders... I rarely get to see her but every time she knows my drink. I don't need to say what I'm ordering, it'll appear before me. That's great service. We tip her well usually around 40-50%. She's that great.

The foods delicious. I'm a sucker for bar food. Especially when it has it's own twist to it. The pizzas, tater tots, sliders, devil eggs are super yummy. I love chilling at the bar with a cocktail, eating tater tots, listening to the music, and watching mute tv and my homies behind me.

Will I be back? Yes!

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
Loved the drink selection and the music mix was awesome! Lots of great danceable 80s tunes. 
We had the all nighter pizza and tacos. Both were tasty.
author: Kristen D.

description:
They had me at "Soup of the Day: Whiskey" sign...and when I saw Jenga and Monkeys in a Barrel on their high top tables I was sold. Co-worker and I decided to pop in there for bites and drinks after work on Monday.  We had a great time hanging out/spreading out (as it was pretty dead there) but that gave us a chance to scope the premises: bartenders were so good/friendly, server was sweet even as she got cut at 8pm before we were finished, and the vibe was just great between the music and what was on TV (boo Chargers lost that night).

Love their design/decor plus menu that incorporates the infamous $22 special (shot of Jameson, Hamm beer, one pizza, and shot of Fernet)...wait, it might be now-defunct as this review has been sitting in my drafts for a month+!  Nonetheless, thumbs up.
author: Jen E.

description:
First time I came here, the drinks were good and their pork belly sliders were delicious.

I came back, and where did that slider go? It's no longer on the menu. Worst of all, we ordered a couple of drinks.. and both were TERRIBLE. I mean, un-drinkably terrible. I don't mean the "Eww it's a whiskey drink and I'm a girly girl who doesn't like to drink whiskey so I'm going to give this place a shitty review"-terrible, I mean, the drinks were REALLY bad. Oh, and I love whiskey by the way.
author: Kazu O.

description:
Must come back to this place! Drinks are strong.  Bartenders are attentive, friendly, fun and entertaining! (Easy on the eyes too!)
Decor (imo) is of an elegant cabin, a tad rugged with a hint of posh and a splash of wow. 
Bathroom was clean. Good sign. 
Didn't order food. Will rate 5 upon my second return, whenever that is. (Soon, I hope)
author: Kora A.

description:
As a self-titled connois-- fan, rather, of establishments that focus on artisanal, specialty cocktails, I was pretty surprised I'd never heard of Southside until my friend's going away party a month or two ago. Needing to drive home later in the evening, I limited myself to the Maiden Lane and the Ramble On. And while the former was a tad bitter, and the latter a bit too sweet, both were still rather enjoyable.

The crowd here is a fairly good mix of your usual SoMA types, and the ambient noise does get pretty high up there when the place gets packed. And, though the cocktail list and the decor of the place would suggest a venue more akin to a lounge, I couldn't help but get a certain pub vibe the entire night - neither a positive nor a negative, just an observation. A solid 3.5 stars.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - While the venue itself is easily navigable, most, if not all, of the tables here were either too low (coffee tables), or too high (bar/counter height). But, if you're only using them for drink placement, then it's not a huge deal.

Bathroom - Accessible!
author: Johnny W.

description:
It gets pretty packed.

Great drinks, friendly service. 

Resurrection - loved
Southside Paloma - pretty dang good
author: Amy O.

description:
Good bar, great prices. Can't go wrong.

Gets crowded during happy hours, hard to find a place to stand, but a very goo place to come after work to get away from it all.
author: Patricia K.

description: I came here late on a Thursday one night and had a ton of fun with 3 other friends as we enjoyed our drinks, truffle tater tots and jenga. I havent been during happy hour, but I feel like it might get really packed. There were a lot of booths/tables available when I went around 9-10ish.
author: Estelle C.

description: I love Southside.  In my 'Top 3' favorite watering holes.  Really solid menu, and they keep adding things.  This is the perfect after work place to kick it downtown.  Friendly staff, good music too.
author: Chris S.

description:
Server (curly hair, dark skin- 3pm on a Tue) was so not friendly, never smiled and I felt super uncomfortable ordering from her. If this is the service i will get next time, i will not go to this place..
The Maiden Lane was SO delicious, the seasonal salad and the beef slider were very good as well. Interior and bar areas are modern, cute, nice. I liked it a lot.. except the attitude from the server. :(. boo.
author: C A.

description: Jacob is the man. Treats his guest well. Even during insanely busy hours. Love the service and drinks. Try the margarita flatbread!
author: Nikhil K.

description:
Stopped in for a few drinks with some friends before they headed out to see the last night of MOMA.  Greg and I passed by here on our way to Thirsty Bear from our home and saw a sign out in front that said "Soup of the Day: Whiskey".  Anyway, we stopped in for a few cocktails and saw that when you order two cocktails on their menu, you get a free pizza!!  FREE PIZZA after ordering two drinks?!?!? ummmm this obviously makes so much sense.  I had the Maiden Lane and my friend had the Gold Rush cocktail.  Mine was served in a mason jar and was definitely pretty potent and strong.  The Gold Rush is served up, and comes garnished with black pepper.  We ordered the Mission Pizza that came with mushrooms and cheese.  All of this makes so much sense, except when it came down to the service.  We had asked the bartender who took our order for drinks if the note on the botton of the menu was true, where getting two cocktails meant a free pizza.  He said yeah, but his reaction was like "UGH. I mean, yeah I GUESS that means you get this."  So, even after saying yes, there was no indication on what/how we order said pizza and we were left sort of guessing about what was next.  We flagged down the second bartender and asked the same question, got a similar response that resembled rolled eyes and heavy sighs, but was pointed to the back of the menu where we could choose which pizza we wanted.  Ultimately we ordered it, it came out, it was actually pretty delicious, and reasonably sized for two people to share.  Naturally our friends caught on to the idea and before you know it, Southside had to pump out 3 more pizzas for our group of friends.  My thoughts on the whole thing: Don't get mad about something that's on your menu, bro.  The most awesome thing here is their cassette tape wall.  Super hipster, but so cool at the same time.

So, the main takeaway here is that the whole idea of this place is good.  The cocktails are priced for SOMA/FiDi, and this free pizza incentive is amazing.  That being said, the attitude of the bartenders here really need to change.  We might be back if we're i the area and in the mood for cocktails + pizza.
author: Lisa I.

description: This place is cozy and the people who work here are very friendly.  The cocktails are good and who doesn't love tots!  Prices are decent and it's pretty close to my office so I'm sure I will be here again.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Review based on Happy hour only. This space gets packed! Be prepared to wait a little for some space to open up on the couch or tables. If you sit at the tables you have to order from the bar.

They have some very yummy drinks! I had the resurrection and the tiki torch. Service for drinks is pretty quick. Food was ok. We ordered the flatbread pizza which was basically pepperoni thin crust pizza with arugula and truffle tots. I wouldn't recommend the pizza but def get the tots!
author: Tiffany L.

description: I came here for a GDC event and had a lot of fun. It's a spacious bar with plenty of elbow room to hangout with friends. I forgot what drinks I had, but the they were really well made!  Nothing was watered down or too strong with alcohol that you couldn't taste anything else. Having Jinga at each table was a bonus!  My friends and I were satisfied and will definitely be back again.
author: Josh S.

description:
Why hello there Southside Spirit House! What a nice find! My friends and I would stumble upon this place, way before we would head across the street to Temple SF for a night out of dancing! By far, this place remains as one of my top SoMa bars in the area. Here's the rundown: wooden furnishings, knick-knack paddy whack give me a glass of alcohol, chalkboard specialty drinks, eye candy looking bartenders, and awesome music makes this place a fave of mine!

Experimental cocktails, to-die for pizza and truffle tater tots, and a round of Jenga to kill time whilst enjoying good company you have with you. Best of all, you can't pass up their Jager shot and glass of beer on the menu. Look for it! Oh, don't mind me, but they have Snake Bite beer in a bottle. Trust. It's super delish to drink alongside with a slice of pizza.

Would I come back? Hell to the eff, YES!

P.S. They offer Happy Hour here! Do try to make it out here before heading out to the clubs!
author: Fraulein C.

description:
Good selection of whiskeys!!! Fun and casual bar with unique decor. 

The "My Cousin Vinny" flatbread was very yummy-- the truffle tots however were a bit too garlicky and fell apart in the serving vessel (more like tater tot hash). 

Other than that minor tater hiccup, I recommend this place if you're looking for a quirky watering hole to catch up with good friends!!
author: Sophie L.

description: Awesome place with great late night menu! The truffle pizza was delicious!! Plus they have cider on Draft!!
author: Jenna A.

description:
Dear Joshy, your a jerk. 

This place is really cute. Always crowed. I wanted to check it out to see what the fuss was about. 

Um...not the service. The bartender was seriously the rudest ever!! I will never come back here again.
author: S Y.
