description: I always come here for trivia nights. They have good drinks, solid food, and a fun environment. They also have jenga that you can play around with.
author: Emy s.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite bars in the city! The servers are pretty nice here, and cool atmosphere. You can even watch the sports game here, too. I had my favorite drink again, which is "Maiden Lane". This drink consist of strawberries, whiskey, ginger beer, and lemon juice. I also was recommended to try the "Grey Hound" because the citrus fruits are fresh and in season. That was definitely a great drink to have, too. Overall, I would like to come here again. 

Another convenient thing is that this bar is right across the street from Temple if you want to enjoy some dancing and/or music at night.
author: Vivian L.

description:
My friends were attempting to bring us to Eve...and we didn't realize it wasn't Eve until we went inside. Huh. 

This place is HELLA loud, and REALLY crowded. I guess it was also a Friday night, so maybe that added to the extra crowdedness of the place. I LOVE that they had the Giants game on, which made it a little less "after work" and a little more "San Francisco."

Drinks here are pretty strong, and decent. I was swayed by their White Manhattan, and HOLY VODKA batman! This thing was like Vodka on ice, with a splash of bitters. 

In the midst of our drinking, my friends (ok, really me) was tempted by their pork belly sliders...so I ordered one. The flavor of it was pretty good, but I wish they seared the belly fat a little longer. I got more mushy lard than that delicious crisp that you can get with belly meat. It came with some pickled veg, which really helped cut the fat. 

Overall, I like this place. They had random games (Would You Rather, Jenga, etc) on the tables for fun. I'm tempted by their Tuesday Trivia nights...hit me up if you want to collaborate on a team! And...your musical tastes go toward country, because that is one genre I do NOT know.
author: Lily W.

description:
I came here for happy hour all my coworkers here last Thursday. One thing you'll notice right away when walking in is that it's LOUD. Like, SUPER LOUD. To the point that when you walk out, you're like "Oh my goodness. I can hear." SO BE PREPARED.

With regards to drinks and food? Drinks are not too shabby (so I heard. I didn't get a chance to drink anything, because I was still getting over a cold). Food? We had ourselves the deviled eggs, Mission pizza, and another ... pizza (I can't recall at the moment, and I can't seem to access the food menu on the website). Pizzas were okay - I found them a bit dry. However, the DEVILED EGGS ARE TO DIE FOR. I could've eaten a bunch of those.

Another good thing about this place is that they have games at the tables (if you're lucky enough to get them). We were playing Jenga the entire evening. I think the group next to us had "Would You Rather?" 

I would have to say - everything was good here, except for the noise level. So I would give this place a 3.5.
author: Joanne W.

description: Beer selection here is not bad, but the crowds here certainly are. I've been here a handful of times and never has there been a time when I was able to find a table to put my drink down on without waiting upwards of 30 minutes to an hour. This place is packed! Southside Spirit House does have a happy hour (till 7pm) which is nice, but it's only limited to beer and wine, no cocktails.
author: Austin W.

description:
The decor is nice, drinks are alright, bartenders are douches. We walked in around quarter to 1am for a drink and wanted to grab a bite. There's a sign clearly posted which states kitchen closes at 1am on Fri/Sat but despite it being before one, the bartender was like "nope, kitchens closed". When asked about the sign that says 1am his response was "you gotta order before 1245". Lazy. 

What made things awesome was that a couple who sat down a few minutes after us had food delivered 10 minutes later. 
So this place did not honor the signs they've posted up, provided service to some but not other customers and the bartenders have a douchy attitude - why would we want to come back here?
author: Mira D.

description: This is definitely my kind of place! Low lighting, lots of little nooks for sitting and catching up, long bar, and lots of delicious foods and nibbles. I Love this place and it is right around the corner from my place. The bartenders were super friendly and helpful and a stranger even bought me a drink. I do think I will be back...often!
author: Christine E.

description: This place is awesome! Almost always busy, so you know the drinks are good. Pizzas are great too, and I love that they have Jenga on deck!
author: Josh P.

description:
I'm really not a bar hopping type of girl. But this bar has to be one of the best one I been to! I dropped by Saturday night with a few friends because we needed a good night out since work has been stressful. Cute bartender that worked Saturday Night kept giving me free shots all night! Can't remember his name since I was pretty buzz. Everyone there was so friendly.

Pros: Friendly bartenders
Good mix crowd
And the bouncers was cool with me going in & out to smoke a cig. All in all I'll be back. :)

Cons: No Grey Goose & No Parton :(
author: Diana K.

description:
What was once formerly the lounge known as Eve, Southside made a few changes to improve the ambiance.  It much better lit now with much more seating.  The place seems more about hustle and bustle than about lounging now.  Which is great cause Eve always seemed empty to me during happy hours, even with it was fairly busy.  

I didn't get to try any of their specialty drinks, but you can't go wrong with Whiskey Neat. The pizzas were good, and we tried the sliders which were decent.  

Although I didn't try the specialty drinks and I thought the food was okay, the big winner here is the ambiance.  If you are looking for a place to hangout for happy and have a few drink this is a nice spot.  Service is fairly good and accommodating for the most part.  And they have a couple of games you can play, most notably the Jenga like blocks.  

Wouldn't be my first choice for Happy Hour, but I wouldn't say no.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Plenty of character with the Jenga sets at tables and art coated walls, great cocktail and beer selection (points for Dogfish Head 90 Min. IPA on tap) with good food, but with the crowdedness, noise, and downtown/financial district crowd I'm just never comfortable here.

My friends ordered the Ramble On cocktail which was good, and I got the Negroni which wasn't that great. I had a much better one at Club Deluxe in the Haight.

We were delighted to realize we happened to go there on pub trivia night (Tuesday), but man were the bro's behind us super loud over the host. Don't get me wrong, I also get pretty zealous in conversation when I'm psyched about a topic (thanks NYC ;) , but if I walk into a place with pub trivia happening, if I'm not playing I either move on or STFU out of respect for the people playing. For almost every question we had to walk up to the announcer and ask again, which made for a long night.

This is kind of how it felt the last time I went for a friend's sendoff. It was way too loud and crowded (no music mind you, just people yelling over each other) and with the location vs. the artsy interiors, it's not much unlike a gallery opening where most people come for the free drinks because it's "something to do". Hard to expect anything else from a place right in the middle of a bunch of newly constructed glass office buildings, that serves alcohol.

So yeah great place with great details to it, but the crowd makes me never want to go there again.
author: Teddy H.

description: We had a cocktail party at Southside for 130 attendees on the eve of a tech conference and it was fantastic! Their delish flatbreads were made and served all night in a perfect rolling schedule. No food was left out to get cold and soggy. It was always fresh. The bartenders were quick. They served our signature cocktail. I was able to get up-to-the-minute bar tab updates so that we stayed on budget. The whole evening was a success! Thanks to Scott and his crew! You were great!
author: Andrea C.

description: I like tater tots, watermelon wheat, cassette tapes, and jenga. Even the art is objectively dope. This is a nice place for a person like me.
author: Kimberly N.

description:
southside spirit house - a love / hate relationship.

love - whitney (the bartender, pretty much the best), selection of beers on tap and in bottles, delicious cocktails, there is food (and pretty good food at that!)

hate - it's SO loud all the time, trivia nights (where it's even more impossible to hear your friends), you have to wait forever to get a drink when it's packed, and that... it;s ALWAYS packed. sigh.

but despite all that, we seem to come back time and time again (and so do others), so they must be doing something right!
author: Christina L.

description: Tacos were great and atmosphere was really nice. The bad side was that the pizza was awful l, the bar tender (guy) was pouring 2.5 counts on all drinks and it was freezing the whole night!
author: Jc W.

description: Great for happy hour. The service was amazing as well. Not too loud on Monday nights.
author: B P.

description:
Great cocktails, really good food. 
Really small space that gets seriously crowded and ver loud though.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Very good place in the soma neighborhood for late night eats, short walking distance from the major hotels like Marriot courtyard , St Regis and the W hotel. 

Pizzas and sliders plus deviled eggs and the kitchen is open till 1am. Look for happy hour food and drinks special as well as other food plus drinks combos
author: Kenneth L.

description: One of my favorite places for happy hour in the SOMA area. They have a really cozy interior, great cocktails, and a good selection of beer. The Maiden Lane is a perfect drink for the ladies, refreshing and comes with muddled strawberries. Brownie points for carrying my favorite beer, Delerium. They also make good flatbread pizzas if you need something to snack on.
author: Angela K.

description:
Southside Spirit House's packed with people during happy house. It's kinda of hard to find a table, but there's plenty of tables around. Just gotta stand around a bit and wait for someone to leave.

== Food and Drinks ==

Pineapple express flatbread pizza tasted pretty good.

Maiden Lane and Ramble On. Ramble On is a blueberry gin drink which tasted great. Definitely would recommend the Ramble On. Maiden Lane is strawberry, whiskey, and ginger beer. For some reason, it tasted like cough syrup.

== Service ==

Order at the bar, get a number, and servers will come with the food. 

== Overall ==

Great place to hit up for happy hour for a good meal and some drinks.
author: Steven B.

description:
This is a gnarly little bar for the Financial District. Not a buttoned-up atmosphere with hipsters touting their finely waxed moustaches, nor are there loud groups of beer-pounding socialites ready for a "party" crowd. It's a bit of a sleepy bar with some cozy booth seating and mean cocktails. My kinda place. 

The Ramble On is a fantastic potation. Gin, lime, and a house-made blueberry basil syrup. Oh, hell yes. 

Next time I'm in SF, there will be a few visits to this spot. Cheers to that.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
Adorable addition to this neighborhood. 

Reasons to love Southside Spirit:
- the cute signage
- the rustic decor
- decent drinks
- JENGA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Yes, you read that correctly, folks. They have jenga sitting on the tables- made for a different kind of Friday night than what you might be used to. Pleasant change of pace.

One observation: Everyone is unusually short. Very odd. Keep your heels at home if you don't want to tower over the boys.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Wet night, warm bourbon. 

It may sound like a John Cougar Mellencamp album but what it is, right, is the best partnership since Milo and Otis. Yeah it's hipstery with its fancy-pants artisinal cocktails and flannel-clad bartenders but who the hell cares, and besides what isn't hipster these days. It's all getting too meta for me to keep up with. Just gimme a Fat Guy IPA at 6.5% (at least I think that's what it was called) and when it taps out offer me a more expensive beer at the same price because that, friends, is service. Huzzah!

The Grateful Dead pizza is a monster, not even a carb-loading, meat-sweating machine like myself (form a line, ladies) could finish it. Ugh, defeated.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Be still, my jaded heart: in one fell swoop, Southside Spirit House has resurrected my love for (somewhat newish) SF bars. First, because of the magnificent female bartender (long dark hair) who was lovely and attentive, even during their busiest (and I second all the Yelpers on the "packed and LOUD" business). Second, because Irish Breakfast tea-honey foam is my new thing (atop Jameson Black Barrel, in the "Tempest in a Teapot" cocktail, for which they've won some award--and deservedly so). Bonus points for offering a nice bar menu, including a pretty great spinach salad with burrata (who doesn't love burrata??), which I opted for in momentary remembrance of this stupid supposed diet I'm on, in lieu of what I've heard are the most amazing truffle tater tots ever. 

Despite its propensity to be so crowded and noisy it can be difficult to find a seat or hear the music, SSH manages to maintain its "neighborhood bar" feel with unpretentious service, a decent mixed crowd, and a comfortable open layout with beautifully appointed (not overdone) contemporary-rustic furniture and decor.
author: samantha c.

description: Only been once and for one drink but liked the vibe, the decor and the drink selection.  Nice wall of liquor and some TVs as well, with high wooden counter seating as well as the bar.   Definitely plan to come back to check it out again.
author: Vivian W.

description:
I was able to park right out front on a Saturday night?? Awesome!   It's very spacious inside, and they have lots of bar top tables that were open.  We ended up at a table with a house made Jenga set, and it kept us pretty entertained during our entire time there.

I was excited about all their cocktails, but I was disappointed when the bartender told me they couldn't customize one of the drinks because they're batched. I feel like a place like this should be making all their drinks individually as they're ordered??

- Ramble On: fresh blueberry, gin, lime, basil - not as sweet as it looks, good for summer
- Maiden Lane: also great for summer with fresh strawberries and ginger beer to balance out the sweetness
- Resurrection: I like drinks with peppers, so the serrano was great with the kiwi, cilantro, and green chartreuse
- Triumphant: whiskey, tequila, with 2 kinds of bitters
- Kentucky Stone Sour: the egg white was a little too stiff, but the combination of wild turkey and amaretto was otherwise good
- Manhattan: slightly sweeter than I like, otherwise pretty standard

We also randomly added on a truffle pizza.  I know - random, right?  The reason we ended up here was because my friends had come across some free pizza special in the past, but they don't do it anymore :(  The flatbread wasn't amazing, but in the setting of many drinks, it was pretty good.

Drinks were good, but like I said, I would have preferred if they could better customize the drinks rather than batching them.  Otherwise, it's a good low key place.
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Although I did not order any of the interesting cocktails or draft beers they have here (I know, it is pretty unforgivable), I do have to say I was pretty satisfied with everything else! The bartenders were very nice (I ordered a Coke and they didn't even want to charge me for it!), the decoration was pretty interesting (with a bunch of cool/odd looking paintings on the wall as well as various cassettes) and the pizza was a killer!

If you are hungry, go for the one called Grateful Dead and you will not regret it! It's on the healthy side (can I say that just because it's got arugula in it?) and was very tasty and pretty crispy. I found the price to be very reasonable too (12 USD, for two people). If you come in with a large group you might wanna sit on the sofa on the corner, which is pretty cozy. The low lighting is also key to create the intimate vibe. 

I'd say this is a place for the ones looking for a low-key night of good food, drinks and conversation.
author: Gabriele J.

description:
bartender changed the channel during SportsCenter Top 10. DURING! WTF. the drinks seem ok.

more like.. South Side Suck House.
author: David W.

description: Cool bar in Soma. Clean, lots of choices for their drinks. Ample seating which provides games for your entertainment. DJ plays cool music and no cover( atleast when I went ). They also serve food till 1 am which I have yet to try and come back to.
author: Claudine V.

description: Came for the happy hour on Wednesday - there weren't any drink deals besides the mini bottle of beer plus a shot, but drinks and food were really good! I tried the Maiden Lane (whiskey, strawberry, ginger beer) and Gold Rush (vodka, pineapple, lime, vermouth), and I enjoyed both. We also ordered truffle tater tots - normally I'm not a tots fan at all, but these were soooo good. Really crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside, topped with garlic, parmesan, and truffle oil. I'd come back just for those!
author: Abby S.

description: Best bar in the whole woooorrrlddd!!!!! I would recommend it to anyone, even though a lot of people can make tatertots I love this place so much!
author: Sophia O.

description:
Honestly I've had to knock it down a few stars because of two recent experiences here. Due to circumstances I've actually wound up here twice in the last week, and both times the new bartenders were snappy and rude. The first time I came in and tried to order the Dia De Los Muertos- they were out of guava. Then i asked the bartender if he could still make the Hooker's boot (see previous review), and his response was : "I'm new here so I have no idea how to make that." Ooookkaaayyy, can you ask someone? I'm pretty sure I'm not the first/ last person to ask for this drink, and as a former bartender I would have offered to try to replicate it or ask the patron what kind of drink they like. Honestly these SOMA bartenders parade around like mixologists, but a true mixologist would be able to make any drink, on the fly, or invent something equally delicious to make someone happy. Frustrated, I asked for a Trumer...they were out. Finally I got a Kellerwies from Sierra Nevada. At this point my co-worker chimes in and makes a comment about the beer and mr. salty bartender asks if he's tried it. Co worker starts to reply he is from Chico and MSB replies "what is that supposed to mean?" Um, Sierra Nevada is from Chico bro.

Fast- forward to last night. Company happy hour. Our group arrives and someone who was assigned to be our server comes up, introduces himself, and says we can order from him or at the bar. I decide to order at the bar and as soon as I get my drink another salty bartender rudely snaps "you know you have a server, right?" From that point on I ordered from our server (who was really nice btw).

I know I'm not alone in this feeling since others remarked they also had salty experiences here. This place is not going to suffer- there's plenty of tech companies and fi-di firms in the area to keep them busy, but as for the monthly company happy hour we'll be going elsewhere from now on.
author: Alyssa J.

description: Late night eats and awesome staff. Plus some drunk Jenga? Love it. It can be super crowded right after work, but don't let that stop you from outlasting everyone. Them truffle tots tho...mmmmm...
author: Chris T.

description:
had a company sponsored event here. made friends with some bartenders who were some of the most awesome people i've met in san francisco.

thanks for being awesome hosts!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
This placed was packed right after work. Fun atmosphere- the little notes on the janga sets on the table were hilarious. Workers were Borderline rude. Drinks were okay. Truffle tater-tots were TO DIE FOR. 


Don't judge me: but the Shirley temples were HORRIBLE
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
My salary didn't increase, but my impression of Southside Spirit House definitely has!

Came here on a Saturday night with friends. It was chill, pleasantly populated and the sun was shining in through the open windows. We ordered cocktails (happy hour 'til 7) and got a free pizza to go along with them (free pizza with two signature cocktails on Saturdays). 

The drinks were excellently made. I despise sweet drinks, so I stay away from most cocktails with fruit in them. My friend got a strawberry cocktail and I had a sip, and I have to say it was sublime. It was like tasting childhood afternoons by the beach (I'm from Hawaii). The fruit flavor was excellent and it was not at all sugary.

Of course, I rather liked my whiskey drink.

Pours were huge. They use those Champagne coups I love, however the ones they use are nearly double the size of the ones at Tradition and Rickhouse. And they're filled up nicely.

The mezcal Negroni was substantial.

Onto the pizza, we ordered the one with squash flowers and burrata. It was large; enough for two. The bartender even asked if we wanted another, since we ordered four drinks. We said no, because we were full, but I suspect that is somewhat unforgivable of us.

Anyway, Southside Spirit House (on a mellow night) has won my heart. Highly recommended.
author: Keane L.

description:
Hangout spot for the young and rich. Briefcases and sport coats make me tense, not relaxed. 

Pros:The staff is laid back and not yuppie-ish. Really nice bathrooms. Drinks were good. 

Cons: laptop case were left to 'save' barstools and the crowd screamed venture-capitalist.
author: Charlie E.

description: I like this place tho it took me a while to find it!! i am a dummy! couldn't tell from across the street that it was literally right next to O'Brien. Friends told me it used to be Eve and i felt even more stupid, cuz i been here before, duh! The place is about the same, but with nicer decor...loads of photos/paintings scattered around the whole bar. Large chalk boards around the bar area Lots of space to stand and if you were lucky enough to find a sitting area, kudos to you. Came in this past Friday for a quick HH with several friends. It was lovely, no complaint (cept the rain when i left...w/o an umbrella =) Had couple of jamiegingers! More HH here to come!
author: Vee V.

description:
Wow it is NOISY! I guess I just don't hangout at bars very often or something. 

The tacos here are those little 3 inch ones but still tasty nonetheless. My sister really loved the pickled jalepenos and the like. 

The pizza was great! There was an egg on top (unexpected!) it was a little hard to eat.

Great little beer selection but the house made cocktails are a hit or miss. 

What bumps this up to 4 stars is the ample amount of seating. Getting old. I need to sit. Hah.
author: Margaret S.

description:
Attempted to visit this location twice. My first visit they earned 3-4 stars. The staff was attentive and managed a large group well.  

My second visit they were unprepared for our planned  group and many of us waited outside after they reached capacity. 

Lesson: fine with friends if you have a plan B. 

edit: Received an update from owner about planned changes to the reservation system. Perhaps they're in better shape now - updated my review to reflect a small group experience.
author: Matt B.

description: Decor is a mix of upscale/hipster. It's busy at night and quite during the day (don't ask). Good selection of Tequila and Gin.
author: Will D.

description: Their online menu is out of date so one of the drinks on it doesn't exist anymore (Hooker's Boot). Bartender was cool enough to make it anyway, but my girlfriend said it was too spicy. I had to drink it down so it didn't go to waste. I liked the Maiden Lane (always support bourbon), but nothing else really stood out for me. There's a lot of seating around, both tables and booths, and the bar is pretty long to accommodate the masses. Kind of pricey ($5 for a Trumer? Damn), and there's not really much else in the area (aside from a loud club), so I'd have this place either be a start or an end point of an evening.
author: Dan M.

description:
real review: 3.5 stars

"Think whisky and rustic" were the words my friend used to describe Southside Spirit House before we came. 

Pretty good selection of whiskey and other liquors here. Cocktails are good, but not superb speakeasy status. The interior has a bit of a laid back artsy naval feel to it. Games are provided and keep the night interesting.

Favorite cocktail: Caged Heat cocktail (whiskey, tamarind, cardamom, ghost peppers). Simply genius and delicious. I would totally come back here for this cocktail again.
author: Brittany J.

description: south beach (soma) location...southside spirit house taking root...mix of bar, food and fun...spacious and mix of large table seating and the bar....$eleven cocktails quite potent warning...$six deviled eggs creamy and delicious...spicy thick cut potato chips and creamy dip $six and heavily seasoned...$eleven corned beef sliders tender goodness and quite flavorful...$nine steak tarter a handful mound...plenty to share, but bit overwhelming for solo...lightly seasoned and tasteful...mushroom pizza scrumptious...dirty pickle juice martini flowing and quite dangerously potent...drinks continuing to flow and being a lush to the end of the night...cheers
author: Hen A.

description:
Having southside in your name is not a bad thing for someone who grew up in Chicago's southside. The ambience is loud and gets crowded when the DJ is spinning on a Friday night.

I recommend going there just after midnight when the place is starting to wind down. You can grab a booth or table easily. 

They offer a few Japanese spirits like Nikka and Yamazaki. Prices are fair for the area you are in. Nikka 15yr was $25.
author: Andy S.

description: Don't be pretentious and reserve the whole damn place. We showed up at 4:30 and had seats, by 5:15 we were 20+ strong. 5:30 we get kicked from our seats for 2 people. By 6:15, 3 more arrived. Great job management on losing probably about $500-$800 we were so pissed we left. Hope Sales Force made up for it.
author: Andrew N.

description:
Don't hate me cause I'm about to sound like my grandma BUT...DAMN this place is LOUD! 

This place is definitely cracking. It's cool atmosphere brings in the crowds by 5pm for happy hour. It echos of people having a great time. They also have music playing starting around 7pm which makes it even louder. I came here with a large group of about 15 people and it was so difficult to converse among my peeps from across our table. I guess I wouldn't mind such a loud atmosphere if I had been expecting it and it was later in the night. I had not been here before and didn't realize it's not really that great for large groups that want to actually talk to each other. 

These specialty drinks were soo good and the staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. I had emailed to reserve a table 2 days before and they hooked us up with a very nice, lounge-y table - plenty of seating for a large crowd. I even got a personalized reserved seating label for..."Chanelle." Oh yeah, that's me -Pretty fancy, huh? They even let us pay and/or open a tab individually instead of one large tab. They really go out of their way to ensure you have a great time. Happy hour means you get $1 off your drink. They also have a late night happy hour. 

I had saw someone walking around with a copper mug and immediately thought "Moscow Mule." Well, I wanted to have a cool copper mug too so I ordered one for myself. Needless to say it didn't come with the cool mug. Apparently people steal them so if you want the cool cup with your drink (not to take home), you must front your ID at the bar as collateral (which of course I was game for). 

Their food menu is pretty amazing. Our waitress recommended a margherita flat bread which is not on the menu and it was probably the best thing That Should Be on the menu. 

I'm not sure how often this happens but there was a new, local vodka company promoting their product by giving out free vodka shots (Seven Still of SF). Who can pass that up? Really cool if they promote local companies like that. 

Lastly, I could not find this place at first so if you are planning an outing here, it's right next to Kate O'Brien's on Howard at 2nd.
author: Chanelle N.

description: Crowd is kind of douchey after work hours, but the drinks and bartenders here are spot-on. Maiden Lane, great way to start. Hit up that Dead Reckoning. Craft beer to sober up. Water? Nah. Get the truffle tots. Same difference. Fried potato goodness. Great ambiance with couches, booths, barstools, and tables. The music here isn't bad either. Pretty pricey though, so be prepared to drop a pretty dollar.
author: Danny C.

description:
05.03.13

Eve revamped itself as Southside Spirit House.  And still remains my fav bar in SoMa.

Original cocktails.  Scrumptious bar food menu.  Renovations that led to a bigger space, complete with high tables and bar stools along the back wall, and TVs with my favorite game on.

It's like you never want me to leave.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Solid beer selection....check.  Even more solid collection of brown liquors....check.   Decent snacks for a bar.....check!  Love this spot.

They've got TVs with sports, a casual vibe but a great mix of cocktails, spirits and beers, and decent food.  It hasn't been too crowded when I've been, but a solid crowd.   I've had sliders and pizzas (thin crust) and both are solid and tasty - at least enough to soak up all the whiskey and bourbon you'll slug down.  They had everything I wanted the last time I went with my co-worker - booker's, blanton's....even some old potrero that my co-worker asked for!!

Bartenders are friendly and chill, and they give a solid pour.

I've been several times, and will definitely be back!
author: Arthur Y.

description:
Went here on a Thursday night for happy hour. We arrived at about 630 and they were "at capacity" so we couldn't even get in. I've never been to a happy hour place that actually turned people away. We went to the Irish pub next door for some beers then tried again and were successful at about 9! Cocktails were awesome - loved the Gauge. A bit pricey but in line with SF/NYC cocktail bars.

Will be back if I'm in that area. Be sure to wait til later in the night if you don't want to be smothered.
author: Sharon R.

description:
Yes! Another great cocktail bar in San Francisco.  What an improvement over the bar formerly known as Eve.

This is the perfect bar to hang out with a group of friends.  The newly designed bar features wood paneling and a couple of sky lights so the atmosphere is bright and inviting.

The cocktail menu is amazing.  The bartenders care about the drinks that they are pouring.  Our group ordered one of everything and they were all spectacular.  But if you are looking for a place to start, I highly recommend the "Maiden Lane" and the "Ramble On".  If you are more of a traditionalist,  you can't go wrong with the "Vieux Kenner."

Check out  the full menu here: http://www.southsidesf.com/menu.html

This bar is awesome!  Each table has Jenga set up and ready to go.  After a few cocktails, try one of the pizzas.  They are delcious!  

If you're searching for a good place to hang out and enjoy a few drinks, don't miss out on the Southside Spirit House.
author: Brian M.

description:
Can't peak for their drinks here but pretty damn good pizza!!!! and potatoes and more pizza!!!!
Hosted our company events here, friendly servers and bartenders but services was slow hence the minus one star.
author: jasmin t.

description: I was assaulted here and the manager/owner was extremely unapologetic and rude. Will never go back and support this poorly run establishment.
author: Matt K.

description:
As a former avid patron of the bar formerly known as Eve, I was a little sad when I heard that the place had shut its doors.  It was home to many happy hours with former coworkers, and it was even the site of a company birthday celebration (with many, many, MANY stories that came from that evening).

With a quizzical eyebrow and a skeptical spirit, I went into Southside and I immediately changed my mind.  The place was remade entirely to where it's...dare I say it... classy.  

And of course it was quite fitting that we had our company reunion at this place as well.  Much like all of us, the place has grown up quite a bit.  I'm quite a fan of the Maiden Lane cocktail (not to saccharine or syrupy) and it was great not to be screaming at each other and straining to hear over loud, bumping music that made no sense. 

Definitely a fan.  And while I don't work on 2nd and Howard anymore (*tear*) will hopefully make it back out to this place for some more grown-up shenanigans.
author: Shay F.

description: Very cool little place, cool vibe. Great beer & bar selections. Food was good too. Very limited food selection, but, the huge collection of spirits and sexy vibe to the place makes it a good hang out.
author: Ara G.

description:
This place is expensive. 

A small beer = $13 during happy hour. It's a little too trendy for my taste. I liked Eve...more down to earth prices.
author: Natalie S.

description: This place is poppin' on Fridays after work hours
author: Thomas C.

description:
Tastefully lit bar, plenty of room, plenty of liquor, and a full selection of wine and beers.

And the bar is pretty conveniently located for the embarcadero crowd, but also pretty full of company men. Bar space between the wall and the drinks is pretty large, so it's a good place for the crowd.

Drinks are pretty standard in pricing -- got a Moscow mule (in a mason jar, of course) plus a wine and a beer for 23 plus tip.

Four stars for a bartender fully holding her own against the onslaught of a yuppie crowd.
author: Christophe C.

description: Whiskey, WHISKEY and more whiskey.  I recommend "the maiden lane".  Cool bartenders, $1 off cocktail happy hours :-) and there is one flat screen tv behind the bar for game watching.  Also, they supply enough random strangers to provide you  with a myriad of factoids for Rutgers football trivia.
author: Hiromi N.

description: All I have to say is get whichever spirit they are featuring at the time, which contains gunpowder seasoning. My friend has gone in the past when there was bourbon with gunpowder seasoning, but when I was in town it was tequila with gunpowder. The smokey-ness of this flavor is such a great compliment to honestly pretty much any drink. Place is packed during happy hour on a Friday night so get there early.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
This place has some downright tasty drinks! I had two of the Ramble On gin cocktails and one Maiden Lane bourbon strawberry lemonade-esque cocktails last Friday and was an extremely happy lush. For those nights that I'm feeling adventurous they also have a few "I wouldn't want to drink another one of these but the ingredient list was too badass to not try it" drinks (a la The Alchemist) that I'm eager to try on a Saturday evening when they have their buy 2 cocktails, get a free pizza promo going.

Now about that pizza...Something about it, I think it was the sauce, didn't taste the way pizza should. As an "eat this so I don't get too tipsy too fast" substance it's fine - but I wouldn't say it's overly enjoyable to eat. The Mission pizza lacked the truffle flavor we all expected (but was heavy on the onion) and the Twin Peaks left everyone -whelmed. Not over, not under, just whelmed. Taste comments aside, I openly admit that the size is decent for the price. I ordered two to share with my table of friends and it was a decent snack for all.

In all, it's really crowded and loud after work but it has a little something for everyone and is worth a visit!
author: Krystle S.

description: I started coming to Southside so often simply because it's so close to my place, but I really love this neighborhood joint.  The atmosphere is pretty chill (although I've never been right after work, but I imagine it tends to get pretty loud then), and it's great for an weeknight cocktail or a place where you can go that has plenty of seating and where you can actually HEAR your friends.  Love that they have jenga! And on Saturday's, they have a deal where if you buy 2 cocktails, you get a free pizza :)
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Finally got to check this place out after bookmarking it for some time; since I don't work in SOMA, I rarely make it past Mission street these days, but a crowded Dada was a blessing in disguise as it forced us to make our way over here. Formerly Eve, I was pleasantly surprised to see how much of an upgrade Southside Spirit House is from its previous decor.

Alcohol is clearly labeled by type, with a heavy selection of whiskeys (obvi, especially if it's their "daily soup" afterall!). My friend and I ordered our drinks (Big Daddy IPA and Powers on the rocks, or, rock to be exact), and the bartender promptly joked with us that we had 2 of the most surly drinks ever. Cheers to that. 

HH is up until 7p on weekdays and they also serve food. Will need to come back to partake!
author: Johanna L.

description: I went on a Friday during happy hour so my review may not be fair.  It was very crowded.  Loud.  The wait for drink took forever and the cocktail was just ok.  Considering the craziness, the bartender was very nice and she smiled and was working hard.  I will go back but not during happy hour.
author: Jean C.

description:
What a cool spot. Came here for a happy hour with friends on Friday. By 5:30 the place was pretty packed. Like many of the new bars popping up around SF the interior has a hip modern vibe with high tables and chairs, plus booths, benches, and stools.

Cocktails are inventive and I love the use of fresh fruit and fun garnishes - especially since they're a good $11 - $13 each. Happy hour gets you $1 off drinks and runs until 7pm.

Food was decent too and I'd describe it as upscale bar food. As your typical starving worker after a long day we ordered truffled tater tots (with parmesan and garlic) - $8 for a small bucket, flatbread pizzas - $15 for 12", and deviled eggs - $6 for 3. 

Located on Howard between 1st and 2nd, this place is frequented by the typical FiDi crowd.
author: Allison R.

description:
What do you do when Temple won't let you in until Midnight? Head over to Southside Spirit House across the street. Better yet, probably should just skip Temple and spend the rest of your wonderful night here. 

I'm getting too old to be going to night clubs, but I still do. I also tell myself I'm too old to eat Pops with chocolate milk, but I still do. What Southside Spirit House offers is a combination of classiness with funsies! Yes, I didn't know what other word to use. Enjoy incredible old school hip hop while sipping on contemporary cocktails while playing Jenga! Yes, yes and yes! I literally could stay here forever. 

Although I only had 1 or 2 drinks here for an hour or so, the time and experience I had is enough to make me want to come back here. The drink I had was super unique. I can't recall the name or exactly what goes inside it but I remember it tasting like Tom Yum Soup topped with whipped egg whites. Not the best tasting drink but my friend's fresh strawberry lemonade and whiskey tasted uh-mazing! Drag the "uh" out for a 21 year old blonde girl sound effect. 

SSH also had other games like trivia and what not and I didn't stay around long enough but I saw a DJ setting up and what looks like a small dance floor towards the front. If the current music was at all an indication of what to come, I give the music 2.75 thumbs up! Nothing more refreshing than old school hip hop in an era drowned out by fist-pumping electro-spinning raver-friend music. 

If you're looking for a relaxing and enjoyable time, head to SSH. You won't regret it!
author: Tung T.

description:
Would've been 4 stars if it weren't for my dismissive bartender.  

I arrived at ~10:45pm on a Saturday night, just in the nick of time to claim one of the last 2 pizzas of the night (free with the purchase of 2 cocktails).  From the moment we sat down at the bar, the bartender was cold.  No smile, no water to start us off.  Just working to pay the bills it seemed.  We ordered the Vieux Kenner, the Ramble On, a Happy Hippie pizza, and pork sliders.  When our pizza arrived sans squash blossoms I was devastated because that was my sole purpose for ordering it in the first place!  (I would've ordered a carnivorous pizza otherwise!)  I inquired about the squash blossoms and the chef was like, "I'm sorry, we ran out!  The bartender should have told you when you ordered!"  Figures.  Later on I wanted an Old Fashioned and asked the bartender if their specialty Autumn Old Fashioned made with maple syrup was sweeter than the classic because I dislike sweet drinks.  Her answer?  "I don't know."  No attempt at an explanation whatsoever.  I'm sorry Missy, but it ain't unreasonable to expect you to understand the ingredients your mixing and if you work in the service industry, it's your job to provide some service!    

It's really too bad, because the rest of the service was excellent - the chef, the busboy, the male bartender were all great.  The male bartender even offered me a free drink for the lack of squash blossoms on my pizza.  

Now finally onto the food and drink.  My Vieux Kenner and Autumn Old Fashioned were both not sweet and overall acceptable, but not complex in flavor.  The Vieux Kenner was light on the Fernet and therefore not very licorice-y, while the maple did not shine through in the Autumn Old Fashioned.  The Ramble on was loaded with muddled blueberries but was otherwise too sweet for my taste -- but it certainly was an excellent girly drink.  The squash blossom-less not so Happy Hippie was topped with fresh, flavorful shrooms and the flatbread crust was excellently crisp and seasoned with parmesan.  Bottom line, the food and drink are all pretty decent, especially for a bar!  In the future if I'm going to spend $11 on a cocktail I'll take my money to the Alembic or one of the B&B bars, but if it's Saturday and I get a free pizza with my drink purchase, I'll be back to revisit Southside Spirit House.  And then maybe I'll get my squash blossom pizza.
author: Beatrice W.

description: I wanted to like this place. Loved the selection of booze but it was just way too loud. It was my farewell happy hour and I couldn't have a simple 2 minute conversation with anyone. Also, the table we reserved was like a heat death trap. So not only could people not hear me, I was a hot sweaty mess. I actually drank a lot less than intended because of this. And... all the guys were wearing the same outfit. Slacks and a pattered button up. It was weird. This place is definitely not my scene.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Something missing.

In a good way: www.youtube.com/watch?v=7HNNQN1bUl8

In a bad way: Out of homemade fig jam so no Southside Pizza.

Wasn't the only thing missing. Ordered the Financial Pizza instead. Garlic oil, squash blossoms, parmesan, mozzarella. Tasted the last one. No idea on first three.

Intrigued by the pork belly sliders too. Blueberry hoisin sounded so good. Think we had it. Neither of us could tell.

Half our meal was left untouched. Decided to Replate (www.replate.org) a few bites in. It was an unspoken understanding. Noise was not missing. Almost too loud to talk.

Drinks were better. Ramble On (gin, lime, homemade blueberry basil syrup) and Maiden Lane (bourbon, strawberries, lime juice, ginger beer) were enjoyable.

Bartenders making them might have woken up on the wrong side of the bed. Menu with clever references and cassette tape wall art had more personality.

Not too expensive (food, drinks were at $11) so the biggest loss was time. And perhaps my hearing from the screaming drunk guy. Confused if we were on Howard or Union.

Next time sticking with Moby: www.youtube.com/watch?v=vV0KmOYfomM
author: Jason B.

description: This location was never very good as Eve, but in its second life it is great as Southside Spirit House. I like the woody interior and relaxed feel. Food and drinks here are solid. The staff here is very easy to work with for group gatherings. I was able to reserve the entire long table section in front for my boyfriend's birthday party without any issue. Our group was well attended to and overall people had a great night. I will definitely be coming back here again.
author: Alice H.

description:
They remodeled the old Eve nicely.  It's open, lighter, and more modern inside.  We were able to reserve a table for our group to celebrate a birthday with no $ minimum - love that!  We had 2 options so we opted for the back booth and it was perfect!  Drinks seemed reasonable - they do specialty cocktails and shots!  haha

They serve food too.  The special on their menu is order 2 specialty cocktails and receive a pizza.  Great deal if you ask me.
author: Meredith K.

description: Trendy SOMA bar/lounge with great drinks, and what looks like really good food too.
author: Vivian H.

description: Maybe it was a fluke but both of the drinks I had here were super gross.  My bf had been here before and said maybe it was an off night.  I guess I'll have to stick to Trick Dog for my drinks!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
one star for terrible service (If I could give zero here, I would)
3 stars for a good happy hour
3 stars for being able to accommodate a large party

I came here for happy hour after work to celebrate a coworkers birthday.  Really convenient because of the vicinity to my office, but because the service was so terrible, I would rather go next door to the Irish bar.  Very nice happy hour prices for SOMA/financial district.  If you can  endure the terrible service, I would say its a decent bar.  

When you go to the bar and order one drink and the bartender with man bun's response is "Just one?" .. that was my cue that I wouldn't be coming back. Also, I just don't understand why you would take someone's order for a salad, have them pay, and then after waiting for 15 minutes come back and say they never serve salad?  Baffling.  Server was not apologetic one bit, apparently it "isn't his problem".  

Plenty of space in the bar (it was a monday) but we were a party of 10+ and we were able to all fit without being squished.  Standing tables, sitting tables and some cushions.  

We stayed for the jenga.
author: Acilegna T.

description:
Strong 4 star bar/restaurant with the ability to earn another star once I've tried more of their food.  

I went here after work with a colleague and I was really impressed by the place.  It is in SOMA and not crowded at all, granted we went on a Wednesday or Thursday night.  They also serve food all night which is great.  You can order up almost any type of whiskey (bourbon, rye, scotch, etc) your heart desires.  They also have Old Potrero Rye which makes it at the top of my list.  

They have some perfect sized thin crust pizzas and sliders that make for a great dinner or late snack.  They also have a sign outside that says "soup of the day: whiskey" which gave me a chuckle.  In fact, I think I'm going to go here tomorrow now that I'm thinking about it more.  Cheers!
author: Kyle I.

description:
Absolutely the WORST cocktail I have ever had! 

We both had horrible cocktails and it was super disappointing! We had the goldrush and the claimjumper. Living in this city we're used to really cool pairing of weird and wonderful concoctions that almost always work.....well the cocktails at Southside didnt work. The Claim jumper with beer and vodka was rancid. The after-taste from one sip was just horrific. I cant believe we just paid $20 + tip for 2 crap cocktails.
author: Nicole E.

description:
Cool vibe. Not that crowded considering we were there with a rather large group on a Saturday. Be sure to ask about their Saturday night special-buy two signature cocktails and get a pizza. Uhh, yes please! 

I placed my drink orders and wasn't told by the bartender about the deal. We found out from our group and waited a while before we could put the order in.The pizzas take forever to come out (there's a small disclaimer about this on the menu, which I appreciate), but they are delicious! I really didn't mind waiting since it is such an amazing deal and we were there to just hang out anyway. 

I tried the Grateful Dead and Happy Hippie pizzas. They were both delicious, but I especially enjoyed the former. 

As for drinks, I recommend the Maiden Lane. 

FYI, $20 minimum for credit card charges.
author: Diana N.

description:
It's really not fair to review a place before it's official grand opening. I stopped by on a scouting mission for future visits. I was a little bummed out that the truffle popcorn was not available, but I got a free shot of absinthe for my disappointment.

The layout is nice to look at and seems great for large groups. I will definitely check it out later when things are in full swing.
author: Jim Z.

description:
My coworkers and I love Southside - it's our go-to for happy hour.  Josh is by far our favorite bartender - you can tell him what you like and he'll whip up a cocktail that's not on the menu.  They've got a great selection of top shelf liquor and specialty drinks - our favorites are Maiden Lane (whiskey, fresh strawberries, lemon juice and ginger beer) and if you like a spicier drink, the Caged Heat is amazing (whiskey, lemon, tamarind, cardamom and ghost pepper.)  They've also got a great menu - I highly recommend the truffle tots and meat and cheese board.  Everything we've had there is delicious.

You can also reserve tables for gatherings at no cost and they're very accommodating. If you work in the financial district, you have to check them out.
author: Nicole M.

description: Chill spot to drink and play games.  The music is kind of loud. I am getting old.  I don't like noise.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Went to a private party. Cool venue, good music, great bar pizza (a bit greasy on the crust but if it's late and your hungry, why not~), and great sliders (I don't even eat slider but they were good).

Drinks were good. Wine they gave me was meh. I asked for Malbec, perhaps I should start being specific so I don't just get any old wine. 

Bathrooms were nice.  (SUPER CRITICAL.)
author: Alice ..

description:
This is a great happy hour spot - its casual and a great after work spot. I love whiskey and per the request of the yelpers, I had to start with the Maiden Lane. While I enjoyed it, it was a bit too sweet for me, I let the bartender know my preferences and asked him for a recommendation so he whipped up a whiskey sour for me with some ginger beer. I really liked his concoction.

His recommendation for flatbread was also great! The Happy Hippie comes topped with caramelized onions and big portabellas giving you an extremely flavorful bite.

I'll definitely be going back to Southside for more happy hours!
author: Analisa S.

description:
Great for happy hour drinks!

They serve mine in a mason jar, can't go wrong with that. I ordered the Maiden Lane (Bourbon, fresh strawberries, lemon juice, ginger beer). Very tasty! Keep in mind, this place gets pretty packed, we came here for HH and there was an event going on so the place was jam-packed. It's a little hard to identify the waiter/ress since they don't wear name tags or uniforms but overall they were accommodating and friendly. 

- Good drinks
- Board games
- Yuppies atmosphere 
- Casual HH

Would love to come back and try their trivia days!
author: Julia K.

description:
Came here for the first time on a Saturday night. The interior is open with long communal tables and some couches lining the outsides. It was a little quiet at first but quickly filled up (and for good reason!).

Impressive beer list with beers like Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA, Stone Arrogant Bastard and Hitachino Nest on tap. On top of beers, I tried the Vieux Kinner (Rye, Cognac, Fernet, Vermouth) which I enjoyed a lot. I tasted some of the other cocktails ordered by friends and those were pretty good as well. 

The bartenders and staff were very friendly and responsive. One of the staff was especially helpful and attentive. After some chatting, we found out he was the owner, Colin, just filling in for the night. He is a cool dude - he let us know about the various specials and when there was a mix-up that delayed a couple of our drinks, he comped those drinks. The greatest revelation of the night is that on Saturdays, if you order two cocktails, you get a free pizza. Mind explosion. My memory is a little foggy about which ones we got (one was prosciutto and fig), but they were tasty.

 Will definitely be back in some capacity. They have a happy hour with $1 off drinks and a late night Spirit Hour with $2 off spirits / $1 off beer and wine. Southside also has TV's, so it could be a good place to catch a game. 

P.S. for the the people commenting on the $13 beer, you probably ordered Hitachino which retails for about $6 for a small bottle. With regular bar markup, $13 is about right.
author: Brian C.

description: Southside spirit house has a great vibe. We went here on a Friday night around 10pm for drinks. The bar wasn't too crowded, there were tables with Jenga on it and a DJ playing music. Its a great bar to come hang out with friends on a easy going Friday night.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Came here a few times for drinks and food.
Service varies from very attentive, friendly, efficient to down right terrible. 

The last time I went, there was only one bartender (and whoever is stuck in the kitchen) and he was so swamped I felt bad for him. Ended up bringing our empty glasses up to the counter for him.
author: B M.

description:
Finally a decent bar with a brown-liquor selection that's in the neighborhood. The bar it replaced was a POS, so any bar would be a step up anyway. 

The cocktails and beers are reasonably priced, and they serve food till well into the night. Late-night drink specials are always a plus.
author: Sid M.

description:
Great late night place to hang out and have some decent food and drink.
I socially liked their pizza.
Almost the only place around immediate neighborhood that serves good food till 1 am.
author: Mehrnaz M.

description:
Visited SSH with a small group of friends for post-dinner drinks on a Saturday night after reading about it on 7x7.  Off the top, I'm pretty impressed with this place.

We all ordered various cocktails and beer and passed it around to taste.  The drink I selected, the "Ramble On," was definitely a home run.  (Gin, fresh lime, house made blueberry basil syrup).  Frankly, I could drink it for days.

To our surprise, there was a Saturday night special where you received a free (whole) pizza with every two cocktails you ordered.  These pizzas are sizable (somewhere between a small and a medium size, 8 slices).  They're also tasty, but there was something missing that I couldn't really put my finger on.  I could see how other reviewers have dinged them on their pizza.  But then again, I don't hold it against them as SSH is not really a pizza place.

Lastly, just a heads up, Saturday night is dead at SSH.  Its a great place to go if you want to sit and chat with food.  But if you're looking for a party, go somewhere else.  This place seems more suited as an after-work happy hour bar/restaurant.

Bottom line, as long as you view SSH from the perspective of a nice place to get drinks, have a seat, chat with friends, and munch on a few things to fill your stomach, you'll have a great time.  If you're looking for the next Pizzeria Delfina, go somewhere else.
author: Bobby L.

description:
Following a huge conference at Moscone, my internal team wanted an easy place to grab a drink and a few bites as our last hurrah, we choose Southside Spirits and could not have been happier. They were easy to work with and able to accommodate a large group without a lot of hassle. The events person Leilani was prompt with a response and easy to work with. Our server, Paige was amazing--never once getting frustrated with our incessant orders for food and drink refills. Amazing customer service is all in the attitude and she was just pleasant and proactive. 

As the evening went on the regulars showed up and I felt like it was a cool place, decent crowd in spite of the 2-3 corporate groups taking over the place. This was my second visit and each consistently great drinks, I loved the Maiden Lane. 

I highly recommend this place.
author: Molly F.

description: Deliciously crafted cocktails and Jenga. I don't need much more for a fantastic evening.
author: Dimple B.

description: Nice selection of whiskeys and cocktails. Additionally staffs are very friendly. I forgot my coat at the bar but Scott kept it with clean condition. Thanks!
author: Aki S.

description: Love this place! Great atmosphere and amazing service. Also, the cocktails and food are great! Don't miss this place for after work drinks or even a weekend night out!
author: Nicole H.

description:
My rating is four stars but I see Southside becoming a five-star bar soon. 

Great drink menu at Southside. The prices for beer and wine are surprisingly reasonable. The draft beer list is full of glasses at either $5 or $6. Only one is at $13, if memory serves. Most glasses of wine in single digits as well. 

The layout is nice, offering plenty of room for multiple groups, and yet it doesn't feel too big just for a twosome. A few TVs are placed strategically around the bar. Plenty of Warriors fans (yes, this is another Bay Area bandwagon time of year, though hopefully one of the folks will be wearing her own Sharks jersey - respeck!) cheering on the Dubs. 

Vieux (spelled viex on the menu) Kenner is a steal at $11 because it tastes good, of course, and packs a punch; it's all alcohol. Get it neat rather than on a big block to taste it chilled and not too cold. You want some flavor to come through.

Closing out the tab wasn't easy if not done immediately when receiving the drinks. Anyway, you may need to speak up, way up, at the bar to get your bartender's attention even if Southside doesn't appear busy. My habit of putting down a credit card only if ordering multiple rounds works against me here. When just buying one round, I pay with cash, unless it's work T&E. Why isn't this more common?
author: Mike H.

description: A cool bar with nice decor. Seems to be pretty popular amongst a 21-45 aged-crowd.  The attendant remembered orders and was never out of sight which was impressive as he was the only one working the floor in that huge bar.  Try the pink lemonade looking drink and the cocktail called the resurrection!  Both were tasty!  So were the tater tots we had to soak up the alcohol a bit!  Enjoy!
author: Wouldn't You L.

description:
It was a Monday night, 5:30 happy hour. 

I walked in and immediately noticed the wall lined with cool leather upholstered seats. It wasn't too crowded and not too loud. The drink meny was really cool-looking and had some great cocktails listed. I got something with Gin and fresh blueberries that was so good, I had another!

I was elated to see the wall leading to the restrooms covered with CASSETTE TAPES! I found my all-time favorite band up there The Police and promptly snapped a shot and of course got it up on Facebook before I even opened the door to the bathroom.

It's so close to my office, I fear I'll be there more often than I should! 

Go check it out, and I'll probably see you there!

PS GREAT service by a nice guy.
author: Natasha M.

description: A few friends and I were bar hoping and decided to make a stop at this bar due to my obsession with whiskey! Good vibes! Great people! Great selection of whiskey! Decently priced drinks! Most definitely would be a spot I would go to again when I come to SF in the future!!
author: Jayce M.

description:
I love this place!
Great environment, service, food and drinks!
Also, convenient hours of operation!

Good job, you guys!
author: Janet V.

description:
Pros: 
- It's a bar. Comes equipped with alcohol & seating!!
- Reasonably priced drinks.
- DJ & room for dancing (although you won't want to).

Cons:
- You might die if you drink here. 
- $20 card minimum (3 drinks). 

Walked in here at 1:00 am yesterday, on Friday night, for a final drink of  the evening because it was close to the Marriott where I was staying.  

The venue itself has potential to not suck - there was a mediocre DJ playing, an area for dancing, ample seating + booth seating good for groups toward the back, and an impressive array of liquor behind the bar.  Not surprisingly though, the place was relatively dead (especially for a Friday night) and the people who were there effectively accomplished giving the place a weird, old-dude vibe.  Not feeling it. 

The purpose of this review was to lament the appalling and abhorrently irresponsible service I received at the end of the night. Come 1:40 am, the lights lifted and the staff began their efforts to round everyone up. We had already purchased 2 drinks for $14 but needed to order a final drink to meet the $20 minimum requirement.  I asked for a Screwdriver, thinking it would be a drink that we could easily share and consume quickly. The bartender informs me that she can't serve me a mixed drink, but offers a shot instead (I assumed this was due to a time consideration - they were trying to get people out after all). So, I ask for an oj back with my shot. I'm told I can't have juice, as it's been put away (under the bar where it always is? Perhaps you should keep out the items needed to service your customers while you're still open...), but I'm offered a soda back and I concede. This woman is in such an all-fired rush to get people out so that she can get off at 2 o'clock on the dot that she negligently hands me a glass of coke that is hot, un-rinsed, and full of chemical sanitizer. Unacceptable. Dangerously so.
author: Kate C.

description: Great bites & drinks! Have had a few get togethers here & everyone had a great time! The flatbread pizzas are AMAZING! I'm a whiskey girl, & they've got some good whiskey drinks as well!
author: Casey L.

description: Fantastic bar to meet a friend after work. It's spacious enough but had a good crowd, friendly bar tenders, happy hour specials, fantastic beer menu and yummy bar food. Some strong stuff on tap to be enjoyed :)  Deviled eggs were creamy and delicious.
author: Aki N.

description: Best truffle tater tots ever!! All around best bar food ever actually. Really loud though, so not the best place if you want to actually talk, but trendy and fun!
author: Christina S.

description: crowded and packed for a Friday HH/evening.  Super hot in the back with poor ventilation.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Loves this place! So many great spirits and bartender (Jason I think his name was) was awesome! Met a couple locals, had good convos and just a great night! Had their tacos and meh wasn't their string suit but drinks were on point! Can't wait to come back and throw back a couple more shots next time I'm in town!
author: Alex P.

description: I've been here a couple times and love this place.  The drinks are great, the people are fierce, and there's Jenga! It's a great place to stop by for a Trivia night (yep, they have that too!) or grab drinks with friends.
author: Shubhra S.

description:
Really great place to pop in after work! I love their beer selection, and it's always lively on a Thursday or Friday night. Plenty of places to sit (if you get there earlier I guess) and the wait staff is pretty attentive for as crowded as it gets. 
The only downfall is how incredibly loud it gets, so conversation with more than three people is difficult, but if you don't mind, this is a fun place to be!

$20 credit card minimum though, so watch out! The prices are certainly great during happy hour, so depending on your drink order it might take a bit to hit that (a good problem to have?).
author: Jessica R.

description: I really liked this place! Tasty drinks, nice bartenders, cool ambiance. I want to come back and try the food next time!
author: Turi F.

description: I like Southside a lot.  I'd give them a 4.75 because the food menu is a bit limited, but they produce high quality from that small kitchen.  Drinks are on point, staff is always friendly and courteous, and Happy Hour allows you to enjoy any alcoholic beverage for $1 off
author: Brett B.

description:
went to an event at the sister bar, John Colins, so when I discovered Southside opened up a few months ago I was excited to finally check it out. 

I chose a vodka based drink but was kind of iffy about it. The bartender immediately sensed that and suggested the Maiden Lane, which is bourbon based so you cant really go wrong :) He definitely seemed like he cared about the drinks he made. I was very happy with mine. 

I think he mentioned they also serve food after 1am, which is a huge plus on weekends near Soma. 

I'll definitely be back with more friends. :)
author: Trisha S.

description: Been adding in SSH to our work happy hour rotation. Been liking their cocktails (Maiden Lane) and they have  "jenga" blocks at the tables.  They should paint them in the chalk paint to let patrons write their own drunk jenga tiles! Anyways, pretty good service here and never too long for a drink. It can get a little crowded but hey that's a good sign.  :D
author: Julie F.

description: Hot spot! Great bar, drink selection, and crowd. It can definitely get packed in here, so get here early to grab some space with friends.
author: J M.

description: This place is just a great regular ol' bar. Nothing fancy but very familiar feeling. It has a great crowd but you can still hear people and the seating is nice and the bartenders are friendly. I think this is a great way to start the night or a good way to finish it. Either way, its a good time.
author: Brittini S.

description:
I normally don't write reviews, but this experience was so egregious that I feel like it needs a special mention. A bar should not serve food if if can't actually deliver.

We arrived at 9:40pm on a Friday night to kill an hour and change before a movie at the Metreon. The good- nice ambiance, busy but not crowded. A fantastic long ceiling/wall mirror lets you people-watch discreetly without being creepy. 

Unfortunately the good stops there. The drink we ordered (Hooker's Boot) tries to be everything at once- sweet, smoky, spicy- and ends up being too much and as subtle as, well, a boot to the face. For the price there are much better drinks in the city.

The worst is that we almost didn't get our food. We ordered sliders at 9:55pm. At 10:45pm, the sliders still have not arrived and we need to go to watch our movie. Only after much prodding of the harried waitstaff do we finally get our food- nearly an hour after we ordered them. The bar was busy but not overly so. There really was no excuse for the wait. Either pare down your menu, increase your staff, or simply stop serving food.
author: Julie W.

description: Great whiskey selection and Our bartender, Jason was extremely helpful and friendly. The corn beef sandwich wasn't half bad either!
author: John O.

description:
Thank you for opening a new bar in FiDi. I've been so sick of Americano, Prospect, Palomino, Rosa Mexicano. Finally a place that has some charm and isn't pretentious or too divey.

We stumbled upon this bar for my co-worker's going away soirée. It was packed on a Friday at 6pm, but they served food! Thank goodness. The pizza is decent. They have a lot of seating as well. I enjoyed my cocktail and the bartenders were nice.

I'll be back!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Tough to compete with Kate's Irish Bar next door, but it does a good job!!!  Happy hour offers a dollar off all drinks, and check out the Saturday night special for a free pizza with two signature cocktails!
author: R J.

description: not the best service. food surprisingly good. also, definitely recommend ordering the Maiden Lane- strawberry juice + alcohol = good.
author: Kate A.

description: I spent a few hours here for trivia a few weeks ago and really came to enjoy the place. It was packed when we first arrived around 7, but we managed to find some seats at the bar until a table opened up. Throughout the night I tried several drinks from their menu which were all tasty, and tried a variety of the food which was also very good. The service was good and they were quick to take care of our group.
author: Candace R.

description: On a Tuesday night, my friend and I went in to get drinks. To our surprise they had a trivia game going on. Great atmosphere and good crowd. We had great drinks! Pizza wasn't that bad either. Bartender was pretty awesome!
author: Blia M.

description: My absolute, most favorite bar! Staff is always super friendly and attentive. It truly is my real life Cheers. I've had a bad night there....'nuff said.
author: Ayesha A.

description: Been here a couple of times for HH. Great drinks, it just takes a little while to get them as the place is packed on weeknights after work...but which place isn't in this area of town. So if you're willing to be a little patient, this place is worth it.
author: George M.

description: Good cocktails and vibe. Really cute interior with dj in the front of the restaurant.
author: Jenny K.

description: I love the look and feel of this establishment.  One part hipster  Bloodhound one part sophisticated Rye Bar.  Now I'm a a little bit older and came of age w Kate O'Briens but need a more mature whiskey rye option.  What I like primarily about Southside Spirit House are the concoctions coming from James.  He got a sense of what we were into and made up familiar cocktails w a twist.  I plan to take my colleagues at our little startup regularly on Monday nights when James is there to do tasting of his diverse and delicious concoctions.  Do you like bitters,  do you like Manhattan's, do you like Citris go to James.  He made the evening creative, delicious, and educational as he provided insight to the cocktail mixology.  The flatbread Greatful Dead was delicious  as well.  Covered in fresh arugula and sausage and spritzed w Truffle oil.  A pub version of the NOPA flatbreads but crispier which we loved.  See you on a Monday.
author: Diana L.

description: All the drinks here are awesome, great selection of top shelf alcohol. I have not had the food , would really like to go back and try some of the menu items looked delicious. My pet peeve though with cool spots like this is : if you are also a BAR you need to have adequate sitting space for BAR PATRONS, not just people eating . I was here for the night before a friend's wedding so we had a lot of people, and it was a Friday and so to be expected there were a ton of other people there and NOWHERE to sit. I think an example of a Bar / Restaurant that does this RIGHT is the Phoenix out in the Mission . There are always places to sit for people just drinking , as well for the dining patrons. I'm elderly basically, I need to sit down
author: Lauren V.

description: A great remodel and really cool new happy hour spot in the SOMA.  Their craft beer selection is really unique and tasty.  Their sliders, deviled eggs and steak tartare all hit the spot and I can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.
author: Sean M.

description: This bar had a great selection and friendly staff. Additionally they have Jenga and Cards Against Humanity to really have some fun. There could be more seating but there is still adequate space overall. Great for a Saturday night outing!
author: Kyle B.

description:
been here years ago and was not a fan. 

came back this past weekend and the place and crowd was definitely a lot better. very eclectic crowd which was nice

maiden lane cocktail -- 6 / 5 stars. loved it
moscow mule -- 3/5. needed some more sparkly or something
(--) horse -- 3.5/5 pretty decent
manhattan -- way strong

definitely coming back to try the food! they had some items that sounded really tasty.
author: Janet Y.

description: Great new little place, quaint, clean and the staff is fun.  The only negative thing was that they ran out of a lot of beers that I was really interested in trying.  I hope this place picks up and to return again and try some new beers.   Truffle flatbread wasn't bad, a little more dough than I would like, but the flavor was still good.
author: N. M.

description: First time here and I was not a big fan from the start. I looked at the selection of beer they had and it was a very weak selection to start off in the first place unless they are more of a strong alcohol type of lounge/bar. The food does not look to amusing either. The beer selection they had as well was pretty expensive which was another thing that was lame. The place inside looks very nice that I have to give to them which I likes the most. There was a weird smell by where I was sitting like old towels that have been used multiple times to clean up a mess. I would not come here again but if you would like to come here to just chill and have a drink then it will not be a bad place to go but just remember to not go to crazy paying for the drinks here since it is a very limited selection and a bit pricy since you can get a shot instead for the price of the beer they sell.
author: David U.

description: This place is just meh.  My friends and I attended the "Hella Smart Trivia Night' every Tuesday.  $6 beers and $13 mixed drinks, whaaaaat?  I thought there were drink specials.  The trivia wasn't all that fun, until the later rounds.  The sound bytes and faces rounds were cool, but questions about science, math, and geography are, like, so elementary.  I also found my governor's mule drink just all right.
author: Andrew J.

description: Their bartenders are competent! This is wonderful. They have some very solid cocktails on their menu that are perfectly balanced
author: Stephen H.

description: This is a great place for the Friday afterwork Happy Hour. It gets a bit crowded after 5:00 ish, but if you get there at 3ish, you and your party can get the seats and play some Jenga. Food is okay... Nothing too special. However the vibe is good, and I always seem to have a good time here.
author: Tim w.

description: i love a good bar with amazing drinks AND FOOD! especially if you go after work, you want to get a drink but eventually you'll get hungry.. this place in fidi finally offers both! the drinks are amazing. i had the MAIDEN LANE (strawberries + bourbon) in a mason jar - cannot go wrong. it is sooo delicious. they have a variety of food on their menu but the TATE TOTS are amazing! the service can be REALLY slow when they're busy so you have to keep on them to get it delivered to your table. but otherwise a great place that i'll definitely come back to. it is a big space and thus, great for groups too. just get there early so you can get a table.
author: Jen S.

description: Interesting drinks, good atmosphere, and friendly enough bartenders. Sometimes it can get crowded and seats can be reserved leaving you awkwardly standing in everyone's way.
author: A C.

description: DJ spinning 45's.... Funk, Soul, Motown??? I can dig it!!!
author: Ja M.

description:
southside spirit house is a great place to come for a relaxing, chill night with friends. i came here on a friday night and it never got crowded. i love the feeling of this place! it's big and spacious yet still intimate with that i'm-not-really-trying-that-hard-to-look-good-but-still-do-anyway vibe. there are a ton of comfortable seating options and the decor is pretty cool (check out the wall of cassette tapes on your way to the bathroom!). the drinks here are strong and made with good ingredients like fresh berries. go for the ramble on and the bourbon and strawberry drink. another plus is that there's food here!! the oven was broken when i came so we couldnt order any pizza, but the cheese platter was delicious. OH. and there's jenga. what more do you need? 

i can't wait to come back here!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Went here for a free Howaboutwe for couples date where me and the bf each got a flight of 3 beers (each 4.5 ounces). The service was great- Leleani was a awesome waitress and curtailed our flights to our tastes.Didn't try the food but it smelled good. Lots of big groups here on Friday night- and they were all playing jenga :D
author: Kajal G.

description:
Just hosted a part of about 30 people last Saturday. I"ve planned many gatherings of all kinds over the years and this is one of the few I've ever hosted where I was able to enjoy the event like a guest.  They did everything and timed everything so well.  I didn't have to check in with them during the event for anything.

First, the events coordinator made the planning so easy.  We met once in person to look at the area we're reserving. Then all food/drink plans were made over email.  The coordinator responded to all my questions in a timely manner and made good suggestions to help my event run smoothly. 

They had our area set up even before I arrived 30 minutes before the event start time.  They also did a good job of keeping people arriving for another party to stay in their section (they had a bigger crowd than my group).  That's not an easy thing to do.

During the event, the food came out piping hot throughout the first half of our 3 hour event. Late comers didn't have to settle for cold food.  All the food was delicious!!!  I had been here before just for drinks and thought the food other people ordered looked great.  So I was relying on my "foodie" instincts and hoped the food would taste as good as they sounded.  Flat bread doesn't sound like fancy party food, but SSH made them with upscale ingredients that are super tasty and elevated them to party food status.  Our waitress was "on it" when getting everyone's drinks.  When I checked with a new arrival about flagging our waitress to take their order, she had already gotten it!

Great food, great drinks, great space, great staff = great party, even for the hostess!!!
author: Lisa T.

description: Gave this place another try and got Excellent service! With the yummy food, delish drinks AND stellar service... I had to give this place 5 stars. Thank you Leilani for such a positive experience!
author: Jess C.

description: My bar - for bars - in this area is really not that high, having worked around this same area for 7 years, but this was one of the worst I've seen in awhile. They did a good job with the interior but it's the bad attitude of the staff, the lame happy hour crowd, and the pizza that tasted like cardboard that has me never wanting to come back. Drinks are also mediocre at best.
author: Aman V.

description: I wish there were more places like this. The pizza is delicious, the beer and whiskey choices are great and the staff is awesome. Im surprised they were busier. More places need to watch how this place runs.
author: Chris J.

description: were there to celebrate a friend's bday. Drinks are good. Maiden lane was nice also tried a colorless whiskey made of corn...  liked it all
author: Astha S.

description:
I went there on a Saturday night and the atmosphere was chill. It's great for big groups (make reservations), not too crowded and the staff was attentive.  Although, other Yelpers complaint about the noise, it wasn't loud at all, but I guess it depends on the night and if there's an event.  A plus was the free pizza with every two special cocktails ordered on Saturday nights and Jenga which was fun to play. 
Will defiantly come back to this place..
author: Rachelle B.

description:
Went for a corporate happy hour. Very crowded for a thursday, but the drinks were pretty good and the pizza was amazing! we ordered the mushroom one and it was really yum!

the bartenders were efficient, which really made the experience a whole lot better.
author: J P.

description: Much better since SSH took over Eve. Brighter, better seating and atmostphere. Still the same-ish good drink selection. I'll keep coming back for that $1-off happy hour!
author: Nick F.

description: This is a nice place, didn't get their drinks but ordered the spinach and mozarella salad and it was very flavorful and delicious.
author: a f.

description: Good food and drinks but terrible client service.  Hipster bartender refused to turn even 1 TV to Sharks game 7 last night saying they had elected to be only NBA that day.  Mind you nobody watching the TVs and no Bay Area teams on.   We had brought 10 people and stayed for 3 hours so I'm surprised at the lack of customer service.
author: Mike W.

description: I don't care if it's petty - Southside does not make good south sides. MINUS 3 STARS.
author: Jen Y.

description: I came in here a few nights ago for dinner and drinks with a friend.  We had a great time.  The food is tasty and so are the drinks.  I recommend the happy hippy pizza.  Super yummy.  The service was great, too.  Lois took care of us and she was prompt, attentive, and friendly.  I'll definitely come back in the future.
author: Christine H.
